After the arrest of a ""Salafist militant"", several dozen protesters gathered outside the police headquarters in Sidi Bouzid to denounce the arrest, but they were dispersed by police firing warning shots, with no reports of violence.
A group of rights defenders and journalists gathered outside the Palace of Justice in the capital Tunis to demand the release of a blogger detained without legal grounds.
A counter protest was staged in support for the government led by the Islamic Ennahdha Movement.
250 Tunisian protesters gathered Friday outside the governments headquarters demanding the resignation of the Islamist-led ruling coalition.
Supporters of the Salafi movement in Tunisia have protested in the city of Sidi Bouzid against what they called arbitrary arrests of its members under the guise of anti-terrorism.
A woman suffered slight injuries when an explosive device went up in the military zone of Mount Chaambi.

The National Army units bombarded, suspected sites detected on the heights of Mounts Samama, in Kasserine.

In Siliana, southwest of Tunis, dozens of demonstrators hurled rocks at police, who tried to disperse them by driving into the crowd and firing tear gas. The protesters placed burning tyres in the town centre, where stones littered the streets and sporadic clashes continued into the early evening. 50 policemen were injured.
In Gabes, most public offices and businesses were closed in response to the UGTTs strike call. A large protest was held in the early afternoon, with no incidents reported.
In Gafsa, police fired tear gas to scatter protesters trying to break into the governors office, with hundreds of people then attacking the headquarters of the ruling Islamist party Ennahda.

Clashes broke out between law enforcement officers and individuals belonging to the ""Salafist"" movement at Cite Al Intilaka,. The police intervened using teargas to disperse protesters who pelted security forces with stones.
""A gang"" of around 60 people attacked the headquarters of a coalition of political parties opposed to Tunisias ruling Islamists in Tunis.
Tunisia police arrested 10 suspected ""jihadists"" of the banned Ansar al-Sharia movement in the northeast of the country triggering clashes with their supporters.
An Army Captain died and a non-commissioned officer injured, as they were seeking to defuse a mine in the area of military operations in Mount Chaambi, in Kasserine.
Demonstrators from the Kasserine Governorate staged a rally condemning ""terrorism"" and expressing support for the security forces ""in their fight against terrorism"".

Tunisia's southern Tozeur region ground to a halt on Wednesday, as the latest in a growing number of strikes around the country was called to protest a lack of development. Several thousand people protested in the town, shouting slogans against the Islamist Ennahda party and the coalition government it leads

Anti-torture campaigners protesting outside the Ministry of Interior in Tunis condemned what they called persistent human rights abuses in detention centres, warning of the remaking of the security apparatus of the former regime.

Tunisias banned jihadist group Ansar al-Sharia, designated a militant organisation by the authorities, gathered Tuesday (December 17th) in central Tunis to mark the third anniversary of the revolution and to call for the establishment of the caliphate.
A rival demonstration by supporters of the ruling Islamist party Ennahda drew about 300 people.
In Sidi Bouzid, civil society groups gathered outside the regional governors headquarters to commemorate the third anniversary of the revolution.
New national budget laws sparked protests organized by trade unions ahead of the plenary parliamentary budget discussion next week.

Residents of Sidi Bouzid and delegation Menzel Bouzaiane observed a sit -in outside the district of the National Guard of Sidi Bouzid to demand the release of a member of the Regional Union of secondary education, and a teacher, arrested Wednesday and accused of trespassing in a position of security and fire attempt.
A criminal gang attacked players from the Park CA A return to Tunis after the game of the SSE.
Tozeur supporters invaded the pitch and threw stones at the police in the middle of the match, which was suspended. According to witnesses, police fired tear gas to disperse supporters.

The inhabitants of the city Ennasr ( governorate of Ariana) and owners of recreational areas ( teahouses , restaurants , cafeterias ) and estate agencies demonstrated yesterday to denounce the statements of representatives of the Union of Republican Security.
Protesters blocked access to the town of El Guettar on Saturday before being dispersed by police.
Military forces fired on Sunday on suspect targets in Mount Chaambi, governorate of Kasserine.
Authorities say the Tunisian coast guard fired on three Egyptian fishing boats intercepted in Tunisias territorial waters, killing one boats captain
Unemployed Tunisian youths ransacked an empty police post in the central region of Gafsa overnight and torched its contents.
In Kasserines Ennour neighbourhood, another police post was torched.
Dozens of protesters attacked a police post in the village of Thala, Kasserine.
Tunisian doctors protest against bill requiring them to serve in inner regions
Salafist groups tried to force their way into the Douar Hicher national guard station, throwing stones and incendiary bottles, which obliged security forces to use tear gas to disperse them.""
Protesters set fire to the police station of Meknassi governorate of Sidi Bouzid. A police vehicle was also torched and two officers injured.

A massive sit-in was organized by the owners of individual and collective. Their show of force , motivated by their protest against the tax increase decided by the new budget law was such that they cut the road to all traffic.
Local inhabitants set fire to tyres and blocked roads in Douar Hicher to protest against the new taxes imposed on vehicles.
Several hundred protesters went on the rampage in the town of Feriana, in the central Kasserine region, attacking a tax office, a police post, a bank and a municipal building.
In Hidra police stations and the National Guard were burned, public buildings looted and streets closed to traffic and vehicles burnt.

Shops and public offices remained closed in Kasserine on Wednesday, as hundreds protested in the streets. They shouted slogans including ""The people want the fall of the regime"", the rallying cry of the Arab Spring.
Dozens of protesters tried to force their way into the offices of the ruling Islamist party Ennahda in the town of Kasserine, but police drove them back with tear gas.
In the town of Thala, in the Kasserine region and where clashes took place late Tuesday, protesters attacked a police post, partly burning it and driving out members of the security forces.
Fresh clashes erupted in Kasserine between protestors and police; general strike announced in region.
A group of individuals attempted to break in to the Bouchebka border outpost, governorate of Kasserine.
Military forces, Thursday, shelled ""militants"" holed in Mount Chaambi by land and air. The army used heavy artillery and ground attack aircraft to bomb ""militants"" hiding in the mountain.

Hundreds of Tunisian lawyers and judges demonstrated Wednesday outside the National Constituent Assembly to condemn the draft constitution, which they say does not guarantee the independence of the judiciary.

Hundreds of unemployed Tunisians clashed with police Friday in the industrial city of Gabes after trying to break into a government building. Violence and disorder triggered Thursday, in the delegation of Jelma ( governorate of Sidi Bouzid ) , following disputes between two clans. A security guard and a resident of Jelma were killed and local security had been burned during other disturbances in the resort.

Jobless Tunisian protesters torched a police post in the central region of Gafsa. The demonstrators set fire to the building in the town of Metlaoui late on Tuesday and confronted policemen.

Clashes erupted Tuesday in Ras Jedir after the Libyan border crossing was closed. Protesters held banners calling for the government to take measures for the crossing to regain its vital activity, saying the shutdown negatively impacted the social and economic status of residents.
Ex-political prisoners in Tunisia protested outside UN offices to demand end to official discrimination.

Protests and clashes between security forces and groups of protesters broke out in Umm Larayes (Governorate of Gafsa) following the announcement of preliminary results of the competitive examination for 316 agents and managers from this locality for the Environment Society and gardening.

The union sergeants and warrant officers of the customs observed a sit- in outside the headquarters of the Directorate General, calling for accelerating the regularization of career employees in the sector
TAP fighter planes fired heavy artillery shells in the Mount Chaambi area after suspicious movements were detected in the area on April 8th.

Clashes between the national security forces and ""extremist"" groups belonging to the banned salafist movement of Ansar al-Sharia. The clashes escalated into the use of tear gas by security forces to disperse demonstrators who threw stones at them.

Clashes resumed, Wednesday evening in Rouhia, between the security forces and religious ""extremists"" close to Ansar al-Sharia movement. The clashes were due to the arrest, Monday night, of 16 ""wanted takfiris"". The group attempted to storm the Rouhia police station, the security forces responded with tear gas to disperse the attackers.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: According to Arab Network for Human Rights Information (Cairo) eight members of the Tunisian army were wounded on April 11 in the explosion of two mines which resulted in the serious injury of two soldiers. The driver of an agricultural tractor was also hit as the home-made bomb exploded at the entrance of the natural park of Mount Chaambi.

A second landmine exploded on Friday evening, north of Mount Chaambis national park (Kasserine) near the brick factory, without making casualties. According to Colonel-Major Rahmouni, ""the 'militants' place these landmines in response to the combing operations of the national army as well as the bombings of their camps.""
The air force bombed a ""militant"" camp in Mount Chaambi (Governorate of Kasserine).

The Tunisian air force bombed militant positions on Mount Chaambi on 12th April.
Popular anger, linked to a major industrial project, "" Gas South "" project, culminated in a general strike on 12 and 13 April in Tataouine.
Popular anger, linked to a major industrial project, "" Gas South "" project, culminated in a general strike on 12 and 13 April in Tataouine.
A peaceful march was staged, Wednesday morning in Tunis, by the families of the martyrs and wounded of the Revolution to protest against the judgements rendered by the Military Court of Appeal
A firefight took place between a military unit stationed inside the closed area in Mount Chaambi and a group of ""militants"" holed up there.
One soldier was killed and another was injured as a landmine explosion hit on Friday a military vehicle near a militant camp in the closed military area in Mount Chaambi.
Backed by combat aircraft and helicopters as well as artillery and mortar shelling, army and security units advanced on all fronts to sweep and take control of the whole Mount Chaambi area.
The area of Mount Sammama came under heavy shelling after militants were spotted as they were attempting to reach the heights of Chaambi to join the surrounded elements.

The families of martyrs and wounded of the revolution, organised a sit-in in front of the ANC ( National Constituent Assembly). They shouted slogans : ""Faithful , faithful to the blood of martyrs"" and sang the national anthem.

Fierce clashes broke out between Tunisian troops and armed men suspected of belonging to Salafi groups near the industrial zone in Kasserine province at the foot of Mount Chaambi. Militants fired at a military helicopter leavin one person injured.
In the industrial zone in Kasserine, three men who aroused suspicion, came under fire.
In the city of Kasserine, three hooded men tried to storm an Internet centre.

Families of the martyrs and wounded of the revolution at the headquarters of the Independent National Coordination Transitional Justice ( CNJIT ), have observed a hunger strike against an unfair trial verdict.

Families of martyrs and wounded of the revolution observed a sit- in outside the headquarters of the Military Tribunal in Sfax , in protest against the verdict of the Military Court of Appeal of Tunis.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: As the International Workers Day marches arrived to Habib Bourguiba Avenue in the capital, the organizing committees members started to physically and verbally attack journalists. 12 were beaten and 15 verbally assaulted.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: On Thursday May 1, the UGTT organised a march in Tunis, which was set to mark the International Workers Day.
After the killing of a male nurse in Ben Gardane, a rally took place denouncing ""terrorism"".
A male nurse at the regional hospital in Ben Guerdane was killed by an ""extremist religious"" group.

The armed forces carried out a campaign against ""militants"" through the mountainous area of Kasserine. ""Several landmines were discovered and destroyed and they conducted targeted shootings on suspicious areas on Mount Chaambi, Semama and Salloum.""

The armed forces carried out a campaign against ""militants"" through the mountainous area of Kasserine. ""Several landmines were discovered and destroyed and they conducted targeted shootings on suspicious areas on Mount Chaambi, Semama and Salloum.""

The armed forces carried out a campaign against ""militants"" through the mountainous area of Kasserine. ""Several landmines were discovered and destroyed and they conducted targeted shootings on suspicious areas on Mount Chaambi, Semama and Salloum.""
Protesters, on Saturday, marched down the main streets of the capital to support families of martyrs and wounded of the Revolution.

A man was killed while another managed to escape and hide in the mountain when the National Army opened fire, on Sunday evening, in the closed military area at the eastern entrance of Mount Chaambi reserve, governorate of Kasserine. The two men refused to comply with orders to stop. AFP claims the two men are tied to Al Qaeda.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Xinhua; AFP
column17: Over 150 persons were wounded during clashes that erupted between the inhabitants of Ghlissia and western Douz in the delegation of southern Douz, in the governorate of Kebili. The dispute is over land ownership right in the locality of Toual El-Hadhalil, where an oil company is planning to carry out oil drilling and prospecting works.
Several associations organized a "" sit- in in solidarity "" to support the claims of the families of martyrs and wounded of the revolution outside the headquarters of the UGTT.
An unidentified group burnt three cars belonging to the security forces.

Security forces in the governorate of Kef observed a sit-in outside the headquarters of the municipality of the city, with the participation of agents within the security forces , the National Guard , prison services and civil protection. The protest was organized to denounce the burning of three cars of the security forces and the attempted arson on the house of a retired commander of the prison service.
An army officer sustained injuries, on Wednesday, while he was defusing an unconventional mine inside the closed military zone of Mount Chaambi believed to be laid by ""militant groups"".

The National Union of Tunisian Journalists (SNJT) condemned an attack by police on a photojournalist while he was covering a protest held by youth groups outside the Ministry of Interior in the Tunisian capital.
Youth groups held a protest outside the Ministry of Interior in the Tunisian capital.
A landmine exploded, on Friday, on Mount Chaambi, killing two soldiers of the National Army and wounding 5 soldiers.
Young protesters demonstrated at the commemoration of the 56th anniversary of the Battle of Remada protesting unemployment and political marginalisation.

column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb said it was responsible for the 27th May attack on the home of Tunisias interior minister that killed four policemen.
Attacks were committed against a number of journalists who suffered verbal and physical violence by the police to prevent them from videotaping outside the Court of Kasserine on 27th May.

The National Trade Union of Tunisian security forces called on security personnel to observe a sit -in outside the Bardo Palace on Thursday ""to express their opposition to the exclusion of the security of their right to citizenship and right to vote. ""
The Popular Front organized a protest at Bourguiba Avenue to call for the development of a national strategy against terrorism.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Clashes between the National Guard and army forces and a group of armed militants erupted, on Sunday in the delegation of Fernana, governorate of Jendouba, with a heavy fire exchange in the regions of El Arieh, Djebel Debaa and Oued Kheljen near the El Faziaa village.

A meeting to introduce the content of the new constitution was held on Sunday in Sousse amid protests of some people present. Police intervened to evacuate disrupters who wanted to prevent National Constituent Assembly (NCA) members from listening and responding to participants remarks.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Clashes continued between Tunisian army and National Guard units and ""militant elements"" in the Fouazhia area of Jendouba Governorate, approximately 150 km west of Tunis
Security forces in the Tunisian city of Medenine held a demonstration to demand the necessary equipment to fight against militant groups.
Units of the army combed the hills of Ouergha (Kef) and conducted an aerial bombardment and artillery of some suspects.
A roadside bomb exploded on a footpath on the outskirts of Jbel Salloum (Governorate of Kasserine). Two individuals suffered injuries and burns after the explosion.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Two ""militants"" were killed and several arrested following a fire exchange between National Guard special units and gunmen in the locality of Ain Debba in the delegation of Fernana, Governorate of Jendouba.

Tunisian warplanes and heavy artillery shelled positions where suspected militants were believed to be hiding in the Selloum Mountain near the town of Hai Ezzouhour in the western Kasserine Governorate.

A sit-in of the National Union of internal security forces (SNFSI) took place in front of the Interior Ministry in Tunis, to ""protest against the suspension of work of four members for their trade union activities"".
Some 300 people marched in Tunis Thursday to condemn the act of a man who allegedly burned his 13-year-old daughter to death because she was walking with a boy.
Security forces arrested 8 'members of the Salafist movement' in the city of El Fahs (Zaghouan) after they blocked the road and were aggressive towards people and private property.
Exchange of fire took place on the night of Sunday to Monday, between security forces and a group of armed militants, in Oued Mimoun Argoub near Jebel Salloum (Governorate of Kasserine).
""A dangerous militant leader"" was arrested on Saturday. National Guard units managed to eliminate six militants after armed clashes.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: In Skhira, Sfax clashes erupted following the intervention of National Guard units to end a sit-in observed by jobless people in companies based in the industrial area of the town.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column16: La Presse (Tunisia); Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: Units of the National Guard and Army on Sunday conducted joint sweeping and shelling operations in a locality on the heights of Fernana (Northwest of Jendouba). A roadside bomb exploded during this operation wounding a part of the National Guard.

Four National Army soldiers and two National Guard officers were wounded, Tuesday morning, following the explosion of a landmine on the way of a military vehicle which was on a sweeping operation of a mountain in the region of Kef.
A landmine killed a 19-year-old Tunisian overnight near Mount Chaambi.
Four soldiers aboard a Hummer were killed by a land mine explosion during an ""anti-terror operation"" at Jebel Ouergha in Kef province.
The day after four Tunisian troops died tracking ""militants"" in Kef, citizens gathered by candlelight on Thursday night (July 3rd) outside the defence ministry in the capital
A sit-in protest was due on Sunday afternoon near the Djerba airport to denounce the degradation of the environmental situation in Ajim Djerba.

Clashes erupted during the night of Thursday to Friday in the town of Kef, between forces and elements of the Salafist movement. Security forces were pelted with Molotov cocktails when they responded to a call for help from a citizen threatened by extremist elements. They responded with teargas.
Tunisian police fired tear gas overnight to disperse protesters demanding the release of suspected members of an Al-Qaeda-linked group arrested in the Sidi Bouzid region.
Imams in Tunisia staged a protest outside the parliament against what they called the harassment of preachers by security bodies and to demand a new legislation to replace the current law.

Clashes resumed between and locals and security forces in Guellala, Djerba. Clashes had erupted after the decision for the re-opening of the landfill on Friday morning, with the assistance of public forces and security forces who used tear gas and plastic bullets
Some 2,000 people, mostly supporters of the main Islamist party, protested in Tunis Friday against Israels military offensive in Gaza.

Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade claimed responsibility for the attack on Tunisia security forces, which killed 15 Tunisian soldiers and injured 18 in the Mount Chaambi area near the Algerian border. The army said one of the militants was killed. Between 40 and 60 gunmen opened fire on twin army posts with machine guns and grenade launchers in the mountainous border region.
Several demonstrators gathered, Thursday evening, at Habib Bourguiba Avenue to condemn the ""militant"" acts perpetrated, Wednesday, in Mount Chaambi with 14 soldiers martyred and 23 others wounded.

Protesters on Friday gathered in front of Al Fatah mosque in downtown Tunis to demonstrate against domestic """"terrorism"""", as well as to showcase their support for the Palestinians suffering from Israeli bombardment.

Activists of civil society organized a peaceful march to demand the Bardo accelerating the enactment of the Anti-""terrorism"" Act, still under discussion in the National Constituent Assembly (NCA). An NCA member of the Popular Current party, started a sit-in to pressure the General Legislation Committee to expedite the drafting of the law.

In Beja, representatives of civil society, trade unionists and members of political parties participated in a march in downtown to express solidarity with the Tunisian people forces of the army and national security and denounce the acts of ""militants"" who caused several casualties among the soldiers.

In Bizerte, representatives of civil society, political parties and national figures participating in the march, denounced all forms of """"terrorism"""" and called to fight violence and eliminate the attackers.
In Gabes, a march was organised which was attended by citizens, civil society and parties.

In the governorate of Kebili, the Secretary General of the Regional Labour Union (URT), told TAP that a peaceful march was staged aiming to denounce """"terrorism"""", to unite the Tunisian people ""under the banner of the country and fight the scourge of ""terrorism"".""

In Mahdia Governorate, participants in the peaceful march in front of the Regional Directorate of Social Affairs called on members of the National Constituent Assembly (ANC) to adopt as soon as possible anti-""terrorism"" legislation in order to combat violence.
In Monastir, participants in the march, part of the Regional Labour Union (URT), chanted slogans calling for the unification of ranks Tunisians for the fight against ""terrorism"".

In the governorate of Siliana, a march began outside the headquarters of the URT and walked the streets of the city. Representatives of civil society and political parties have called for the need to fight against ""terrorism"", which threatens the sovereignty of the state..

In Sousse, members of the Executive Board of the URT participated in a march to denounce the ""militant"" operations that targeted soldiers of the National Army. Representatives of civil society refused to participate in the walk because of the limited number of participants.

The head of an armed ""militant"" group in Garn Halfaya (Kef) was arrested by the security forces in the area near Garn Halfaya to Tajerouine. During this operation, a native of the delegation Tajerouine (Kef) woman was injured by bullets in the chest and left hand during a raid by security forces.

A large national march was staged, Saturday, in Habib Bourguiba avenue in Tunis to say no to """"terrorism"""". A few skirmishes between security forces and some demonstrators who requested that leaders of Ennahdha movement leave the march took place.
Arrests: Counter-terrorism units in Tunisia arrested 63 suspects in sweeping security raids in the governorates of Sidi Bouzid, Kef and Kasserine.
A sit-in was held on Sunday in the square of Bab Jebli, in the city of Sfax, to denounce the attack against the members of the National Army on Mount Chaambi last Wednesday
A popular march was staged in Tozeur, by the call of the Regional Union of Labour (URT), to condemn the ""militant"" attack perpetrated last Wednesday in Mount Chaambi.

column7: LPR: League for the Protection of the Revolution
column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: Scores of people attacked a convoy belonging to Nidaa Tounes party, on July 20 in El-Hamma district in Gabes Governorate, in south-eastern Tunisia. Scores of people, who are reportedly linked to the remnants of Revolution Protection league, attacked the conv0y by throwing stones at it and besieged it. Thereafter, they followed them to their place of residence in the city, where they started to throw stones.

The Bardo Square hosted a rally in commemoration of the one-year anniversary of the killing of Mohamed Brahmi, former Secretary-General of the Popular Current, who was killed on July 25, 2013. The crowd, joined by several politicians and civil society activists, shouted slogans against ""terrorism"", religious extremism and intolerance.
Protesters marched, on Friday night, in Habib Bourguiba Avenue in Tunis to denounce the Zionist attack on Gaza.

Two soldiers were killed and five injured, on Saturday, in a firefight between militants and a military patrol in Ain Mazer, a locality between Sakiet Sidi Youssef and Touiref, not far from the Tunisian-Algerian border. Ansar al-Sharia later claimed responsibility.

National Army helicopters were deployed Tuesday in Mount Sammama, firing rockets and machine guns and ""wounding ""militants,"" a military source claimed. Three members of Tunisias security service were wounded when the armed """"militant"""" group fired on their helicopter as they flew over Mount Semmama.

column7: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: A gunfight took place, Thursday afternoon, in the locality of Ain Debba (Fernana), in the governorate of Jendouba, between national guards and soldiers on one hand, and armed militants on the other.

column7: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Fire exchange took place in Ain Debba zone, near the village of Fouazia, in the delegation of Fernana (Governorate of Jendouba) on Friday, during a combing operation carried out by the special forces to destroy a hideout in Oued El Kheljane.

column7: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: The security forces and National Guard in the delegation of Hydra (Kasserine) repelled an attack by an armed group. The security forces responded with gunfire to attack the militants who tried to storm the office of the National Guard and attacking security forces. No casualties were reported.
A police post in the city of Kasserine was attacked on the 02/08/2014, but there were no casualties.
A serviceman was killed in a gunfire exchange when an armed group attacked the barracks of Sbeitla, governorate of Kasserine. A civilian was injured in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Units of the National Guard exchanged fire with a violent militant group in Sidi Bouzid. A number of individuals were arrested.

A group of journalists gathered in the Tunisian capital to voice their support for the Palestinians. The journalists condemned what they called Israeli aggression on Gaza during a protest at the headquarters of the National Union of Tunisian Journalists in Tunis.
Civil society groups in Bizerte demonstrated to denounce the Israeli aggression against Gaza.
Seventeen radical Islamists were arrested in Sousse for preventing by force the imam of the Omar Ibn Khattab Mosque to the Friday sermon and for throwing stones at security forces.
A warrant officer was wounded during clashes that took place between the national army and an armed militant group, in Mount Semmama (governorate of Kasserine).
An anti-tank mine exploded, Monday evening in Djebel Smama, Kasserine, on a combing operation by military vehicle without causing casualties. Two other mines were found and defused.
Tunisia marked its Womens Day with a rally in solidarity with Palestine.
Following a dispute, a young woman was abused by police in the center of the capital.
The Tunisian army forces in Semmama Mountain, Kasserine, eliminated five militants including an Algerian commander.
During the month of August, there were no fewer than 88 protests in 21 governorates of Tunisia. Apart from Ben Arous and Siliana, all other regions experienced protests.

Many Moroccans fleeing the violence in Libya protested Friday outside the consulate of their country. Note that the envoy of the TAP could not get in touch with officials at the Consulate of Morocco in Tunisia which was closed.
During the month of August, there were no fewer than 88 protests in 21 governorates of Tunisia. Apart from Ben Arous and Siliana, all other regions experienced protests.
Two elements from the National Army were injured in a landmine explosion in the military zone of Henchir Tella in Mount Chaambi, Kasserine Governorate.
A soldier sustained minor injuries in a firefight between National Army forces and militants in Mount Chaambi.
The father of a self-immolation victim organised a sit-in outside Msaken police station calling for the condemnation of municipal officials who have used their power to torture and incite suicide.
Two young girls onboard a car that failed to comply with police order were shot dead by law enforcement personnel on Saturday at dawn in Kasserine.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: On Saturday August 30, some security personnel, who were at a security zone in Djerba, assaulted a blogger and her guard by beating, insulting and kicking them, while they were in her car nearby the security zone.
A police patrol repelled an attack by a militant group at the main entrance of the city of Kasserine. There were no reported casualties.

A member of the National Constituent Assembly from Kasserine and legislative candidate of ""Nidaa Tounes"" was the target of an assassination attempt when gunmen stormed his house in the Ezzouhour district in Kasserine.
A 25-year-old engineer arrested on 10 September 2014 by the antiterrorism squad was held in custody and tortured, a human rights organisation denounces.

A police station was attacked by rioters, resulting in the wounding of three members of the security force. Police in the southern town of Douz resorted to tear gas to disperse a crowd which had gathered, and arrested 21 people.
Clashes continued between Islamist rioters and police forces in Douz. Rioters used burning tyres to block roads and threw stones at police who replied with tear gas.

column16: Arabic Network for Human Rights Information
column17: On September 12, 2014, protesters attacked the journalist of ""Tunisia News Network"" and a photographer covering the protest of the employees of the Tunisia Power and Gas Company in front of the National Constituent Assembly.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: In Ben Guerdane, National Guards arrested the militant Mohamed Ali Gharbi, Laroui who is connected to the Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade. He was armed with a weapon and attempted to assault one of the officers of the National Guard.

column7: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: National guard and army units clashes with militants in the region of ""Mazrek Eshems"", in Kasserine killing one.

column7: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: National guard and army units clashes with militants in the region of ""Mazrek Eshems"", killing one.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Arrests: National Guard units arrested 25 people affiliated with the Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade controlled by the militant Mohamed Ali Gharbi (native of Sidi Bouzid). In Meknassy, security units managed to capture elements involved in supplying the armed groups of Chaambi.
Employees of STEG renewable energy went on strike for two days. They demonstrated loudly shouting outside the headquarters of the National Constituent Assembly.
A Syrian was shot and killed and four others injured as they attempted to cross the Tunisian border into Libya.
A demonstration took place against the ISIS group in the main avenue of Tunis.
Several dozen youths gathered in front of the Municipal Theater on Avenue Bourguiba to express their anger against ISIS.

Youth groups in El Hamma, governorate of Gabes blocked Monday, all access to the city by a pile of burning tires in protest against the refusal of the Ministry of Health to create a health center for treatment of cancers.
The professors of the Faculty of Law and Political Sciences of Tunis decided to observe a sit-in yesterday at 10:00 am, at the headquarters of the faculty.
The Tunisian Air Force bombarded militant hideout locations on the Ouergha Mountain in El Kef Governorate.
Twenty-seven Tunisian associations organized a protest against torture in front of the Interior Ministry in Tunis on 15 October.

Tunisians on Thursday (October 16th) demonstrated outside the foreign ministry in Tunis to demand that their government do more to secure the safe release of two journalists held captive in Libya for some 40 days.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Arrests: In the southern city of Gabes, local national guard units arrested one the most dangerous militants believed to be part of the Katibat Okba Ibn Nefaa group. Security forces acted on a tip-off which led to his arrest alongside with his militant group in possession of two Kalashnikov weapons, a pistol, a grenade, and ammunition.
Internal security forces in the governorate of Tozeur called, during a sit-in, for the improvement of health services security agents.
Families of members of the martyred and wounded of the revolution held a protest at the Avenue Habib Bourguiba, in Tunis.
A Tunisian policeman was killed in a firefight with an unidentified armed group in the town of Oued Ellil near the capital Thursday
Police clashed with two militants in Kebili, 500 kilometres (300 miles) south of Tunis. The suspects were arrested after killing a private security guard in the gunfight.

Five Tunisian soldiers were injured when a landmine exploded on Thursday near Sakiet Sidi Youssef, a border town on the Tunisian-Algerian frontiers. An earlier armed confrontation between soldiers and a group of militants in Sakiet Sidi Youssef also left two more soldiers wounded.
Tunisian police killed six suspected militants, five of them women, in a raid on a suburban house. Some of the militants belonged to Ansar-al Sharia.
Units of the national army on the heights of Kef and Jendouba carried out air raids on sites suspected of harboring militants.
Units of the national army on the heights of Kef and Jendouba carried out air raids on sites suspected of harboring militants.
The joint security units of Jendouba exchanged fire with militants near Azaiez district in north Jendouba. One citizen was wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: Arrests: Thirty militants were arrested by the National Guard unit, in relation with the attack in Chebaou in Oued Ellil (Governorate of Ariana).
Protesters gathered at Tunis International Carthage Airport to demonstrate against the visit of the French philosopher Bernard-Henri Levy.
Young people demonstrated peacefully in Dhehiba delegation in Tataouine over unemployment.
Militants attacked a bus carrying off-duty soldiers near Nebeur in the governorate of El Kef killing 5.

column7: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: The general union of the national guard called for rally around the military and security institutions of El Kef against an attack on a military bus.
Residents of Nebeur, Governorate of Kef, on Monday, staged a peaceful march to denounce the scourge of ""terrorism"" and express solidarity with the military and security institutions.
Activists of civil society demonstrated outside the local former RCD Zarzis. The protest involved fishermen whose requests had not been met.

column9: UGTT: Tunisian General Labour Union; Labour Group (Tunisia)
column17: Individuals belonging to political parties attempted to assault the Secretary General of the UGTT in his office. They destroyed his car as they left the office.
In Gafsa, workers staged a protest movement against the privatization of an environment and gardening company. Police dispersed protesters with tear gas.
Students from the National School of Computer Technology (ENSI) entered sit-ins against a renaming of their school.
The national army bombed areas where militants would be entrenched in Mount Ouergha, Kef. The army continued shelling the area of ""Lella Aicha"" in Mount Ouergha.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: National guard units killed an armed militant at a firefight in Sidi Bouzid. One National Guard was injured.
Bodies of three militants killed by army units were found during search operations conducted by the National Army in the closed military area in Mount Chaambi.
Parents and family members of Tunisians imprisoned in Syria and other countries abroad staged a protest blaming President Marzouki for the lack of cooperation with foreign authorities over the issue.

Al-Jazeera correspondent Maisa Fatnassi said that demonstrations in Medenine, Kasserine, Tataouine and other regions were not organized by any party but were held to express peoples anger at remarks by Essebi that they say targeted them ""directly"".
A soldier was killed on Thursday night in an attack on military barracks of Zaaroura in Bizerte governorate.
A large protest occurred in Tataouine to denounce comments attributed to the presidential candidate Essebi.

Large protests erupted on Thursday in the southern city of Medenine in response to comments made by presidential candidate Beji Caid Essebsi earlier this week, after he described Tunisians who supported interim president Marzouki as ""Islamist extremists and jihadists""

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2011-2014) National Guard
column17: A national guard agent was kidnapped and beheaded on Sunday near the town of Kef, northwest of Tunisia by an armed group that the Interior Ministry qualified as ""militants"".
One Tunisian soldier was killed and one injured during a landmine explosion on Mount Samama in the governorate of Kasserine, near the Algerian border.

column7: UGET: General Union of Tunisian Students
column9: UGTE: General Tunisian Union of Students
column17: Clashes between UGTE and UGET students occurred in the Faculty of Humanities in the town of Manouba. Several students have been reported injured.

column7: UGET: General Union of Tunisian Students
column9: UGTE: General Tunisian Union of Students
column17: Clashes between leftist and Islamist students took place in the Faculty of Humanities in the town of Kairouan. Several students have been reported injured.
Five armed men were killed and four arrested during a military operation launched by the Tunisian army near the town of Kasserine, the Ministry of Interiors spokesman announced.
Civil society organisations staged a protest march on the fourth anniversary of the beginning of the revolution in Sidi Bouzid to voice their discontent over exclusion and marginalisation.

column7: ATIR: Tunisian Association of Kidney Disease Sufferers
column17: On Thursday, the Tunisian Association of Kidney Disease Sufferers organised a sit-in in front of the National Welfare of Illness Insurance (CNAM) in Tunis to protest against the abolition of health benefits.

An group armed with shotguns tried to attack a school containing electoral material. A gunman was killed and other three arrested by the soldiers stationed in the school. A government spokesman denied the involvement of Islamists in the attack.
Protests erupted in El Hamma after results of the presidential run-off. Around 300 demonstrators threw stones at the local police, who reacted using teargas.

column16: Shems FM; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: Four police forces were wounded on Monday as a consequence of the clashes erupted after the communication of election results.

Demonstrators set fire to Nidaa Tounes HQ in Tataouine after the results of the presidential run-off elections. The local police station and customs were also attacked, triggering the reaction of the security forces who used teargas to disperse the rioters.

Clashes resumed on Monday in the town of El Hamma between security forces and a group of youth who set fire to a police station and a national guard station, hurled stones at security forces and burnt tyres in streets and on roads. The protesters were claiming the release of demonstrators arrested Sunday afternoon after exit polls results of the presidential run-off.
On December 22, dozens of demonstrators protested against the results of the presidential poll. The security forces used tear gas to disperse protesters.
Violent demonstrations against the result of the presidential poll erupted in Ben Guerdane, Radio France Internationale reports. Police forces restored calm after firing teargas.

The bodies of two militants were found, Monday, in Mount Chaambi as army units were conducting search operations in the closed military area, the National Defence Ministry announced. The two militants were likely killed in air strikes.

Protesters in the southern town of Souk Lahad burned the local HQ of the National Guard, as well as the local HQ of the Nidaa Tounes (Tunisias Call) party and part of the administrative headquarters of the Souk Lahad delegation on the morning of 24 December, National Tunisian TV reported.
A sit-in and a march were staged on Tuesday in Kebili to protest against election results.
A march was held to protest against the demand the release of demonstrators in Douz. The protesters were arrested following the unrest erupted after the results of the presidential poll.
Clashes erupted in the delegation of Regueb in Sidi Bouzid, between protestors and security forces who used tear gas to disperse them.

A group of protestors in Sidi Bouzid blocked the main road of the city, Tuesday night, and set fire to car tyres as a protest against the presidential runoff results, TAP correspondent in the region reported.
A Salafist group attacked the National Guards local station, throwing stones and incendiary bottles and storming the offices. Local police reacted firing teargas.
A man, described as a dangerous militant, was killed on Wednesday by the Tunisian special forces combating terrorism, the government has announced.

column7: SGEB: General Union of Primary Education; Teachers (Tunisia)
column17: The General Union of Primary Education and the Union of Primary Education Inspectors staged a sit-in on Friday in front of the Parliament to protest against the decision to introduce a final exam and English and French classes in primary school.
Suspected Islamist extremists slit the throat of a Tunisian policeman in Zaghouan province overnight, the interior ministry said on Sunday.

Clashes between police and protesters began on Sunday in Redeyef when the Gafsa Phosphate Company started carrying phosphate to the Tunisian Chemical Group (GCT) on trains and private trucks. Phosphate production and transport have been paralysed due to a strike observed by employees of the Tunisian company for transport of mining products since December 13, 2014.

A group of youth from the town of Redeyef, on Monday night, torched the local police station located in the city centre, after clashes with security forces, eye-witnesses told TAP correspondent in Gafsa.

On Wednesday, the unions representing the police forces, the National Guard and the Civil Protection in Tozeur District have organised a sit-in in front of the National Guard HQ in Tozeur to demand enhanced protection measures against militant attacks.
A large march was organised the students of the faculty of engineering in Tunis to demand the cancellation of a policy concerning vocational training and higher education.
A masked man attempted Thursday to stab a police officer in El Aouina, Tunis northern suburbs. The assailant is on the run, said spokesperson for the Interior Ministry Mohamed Ali Laroui.
Members of the Tunisian civil society gathered in front of the Cathedral in Tunis to express their solidarity with the French magazine Charlie Hebdo.
Sit-ins were staged in Sfax and Monastir to express solidarity with the two Tunisian journalists allegedly executed by a Libyan group affiliated with the Islamic State.
Sit-ins were staged in Sfax and Monastir to express solidarity with the two Tunisian journalists allegedly executed by a Libyan group affiliated with the Islamic State.

Around 300 people gathered in Tunis for a demonstration of solidarity with the Charlie Hebdo magazine and two Tunisian journalists that a Libyan armed group associated with the Islamic State claimed to have executed.
A soldier in uniform was attacked, on Wednesday, with a sharp object by unknown persons. He was wounded in the neck at El Mourouj, in the suburbs of Tunis.
Dozens of families marched in the centre of Tunis on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of the revolution.

Family members of the people killed or wounded during the 2011 uprising interrupted President Beji Caid Essebsi during a ceremony for the fourth anniversary of the revolution. The demonstrators lamented the lack of justice during the transition to democracy.

Journalists and civil society members gathered in fron the municipality of Beja to express their solidarity with the two Tunisian journalists kidnapped in Libya. They also encouraged the government to engage in the liberation of the two.

National security officers staged a protest in front the Assembly of the Representatives of the People in Le Bardo, Tunis to demand the approval of an anti-terrorism law.In particular, they protested against the arrest of a colleague detained after the shooting of two alleged militants in Kasserine.

column7: UCAO: Union of Customs Agents and Officials
column17: The Union of Customs Agents and Officials organised a protests in front of the National Parliament to demand a national security strategy.

column7: MIN FPE: Association of Agents in the Ministry of Vocational Training and Employment
column17: The workers of the Ministry of Vocational Training and Employment protested on Thursday against the suppression of the Ministry in the incoming executive.
Several demonstrators thereatened to commit suicide following an allegedly rigged hiring process at the Phosphate Company in Gafsa.
Tunisian activists yesterday organised a protest in front of the Egyptian embassy in Tunis to condemn the killing of Egyptian activist Shaima Sabbagh, the Anadolu Agency reported.

column16: Maghreb Emergent; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: In Ben Gardane, protesters blocked the roads leading to the border passage of Ras Jedir, opposing the introduction of a custom tax on non -Tunisian citizens.

Skirmishes between protesters and police occurred in Metouia, Gabes province. Protests erupted following the appointments of a local chied of police. The demonstrators set tyres on fire and threw stones against the police.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Maghreb Emergent
column17: In Ben Gardane, protesters blocked the roads leading to the border passage of Ras Jedir, opposing the introduction of a custom tax on non -Tunisian citizens. They also contest the decision of Libyan authorities to prevent Libyan merchandising from entering in Tunisia.
Protests resumed in Ben Gardane, as demonstrators gathered in Place du Grand Maghreb setting tyres on fire and blocking the road leading to Ras Jedir.
Protesters in Metouia blocked on Monday the National Route n.15 following the clashes between young people and the police.
A general strike was called by the UGTT in Metouia. Demonstrators blocked some routes and continued to protest against the appointment of a police chief in town.

Local youth have observed protests over the past days at the road between this region and the Dhehiba-Wazen border crossing to claim the right to employment and development and call for restoring trade activity between Tunisia and Libya.

Protests erupted in Dehiba, southern Tunisia, after the introduction of a tax on trans-border trade. Molotov bottles were thrown on the local National Guard post, injuring five gendarmes. Teargas wear launched to disperse the protesters.

Arrests: Between Wednesday and Friday, 32 militant Islamists, some of them returning from fighting in Syria, who were planning attacks in Tunisia, have been arrested in different anti-militant operations throguhout the country.
A march of protest was staged in Sfax, as construction workers demanded social welfare, a minimum wage, inflation control and a stronger purchasing power.

A demonstration in support of the population of Dehiba was held in Bin Guerdane. A young man was injured in the eye in clashes between protesters and security forces. Clashes erupted after a group of protesters hurled stones at the police station located in the Arab Maghreb Avenue. Police responded by using tear gas to push back and disperse protesters.

A man from the delegation of Dhehiba, Governorate of Tataouine, died on Sunday after inhaling tear gas launched during clashes between national guard officers and protesters besieging the border guard post. Police fired warning shots and teargas to disperse protesters. Several people were also injured.
Clashes erupted in Bengardane between security forces and protesters who demand the normalisation of the passage in the Ras Jedir border post.
Ten agents were wounded following an attack carried out by militants in Sbeitla, in Kasserine province. Five attackers were also arrested, report African Manager citing the newspaper Achourouk.
Demonstrations in support of the population of Dehiba were held in Ghomrassen, Bir Lahmar and Medenine.
Demonstrations in support of the population of Dehiba were held in Ghomrassen, Bir Lahmar and Medenine.
Demonstrations in support of the population of Dehiba were held in Ghomrassen, Bir Lahmar and Medenine.

Having located a number of hideouts where militants are holed up in mounts Salloum and Samama (in the governorate Kasserine), the army shelled, Thursday, these positions with artillery and fighter-bombers, spokesperson of the National Defence Ministry lieutenant-colonel Belhassen Oueslati announced. Special force units were sent on the spot and are now conducting a large combing operation of the area, the spokesman added in as statement to TAP.

Special force units were sent on the spot and are now conducting a large combing operation of the area, the spokesman added in as statement to TAP.
Arrests: 415 people were arrested in a vast security campaign launched by police units across the country.
Some people from Ben Guerdane tried to block the border post of Ras Jedir, demanding the closure of border passage until that commercial activities will not resume and border tax removed.
Unidentified persons, early on Sunday, attacked the seat of the Douar Hicher delegation using molotov cocktails.

The circulation of people and vehicles across the Ras Jedir border post is almost entirely blocked due to a sit-in in the border town of Ben Guerdane. Protesters continues to demand that the resume of commercial activities and the removal of a border tax.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Four National Guard officers were killed in a militant attack in the town of Boulaaba, in the governorate of Kasserine. A group of 20 militants attacked a patrol of the National Guard,"" two kilometres (1.2 miles) from Kasserine, which lies at the foot of Mount Chaambi. The gunmen opened fire at a police car, killing the four policemen, and fled with their weapons. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the assault, but a Twitter account close to Okba Ibn Nafaa praised the attack.

The circulation of people and vehicles across the Ras Jedir border post is almost entirely blocked due to a sit-in in the border town of Ben Guerdane. Protesters continues to demand that the resume of commercial activities and the removal of a border tax.

Tensions in Kasserine when the security forces who gathered at the local hospital voiced dissatisfaction with the working conditions and protested against the lack of equipment and security reinforcement.

A militant group attacked a house in the locality of Gouarech, in Sakiet Sidi Youssef, and obliged the owner to provide them with foodstuff. Eye-witnesses told TAP correspondent group who includes 15 persons had also attacked a commodity store in the same locality and took away a quantity of foodstuff. Security sources in the region confirmed the attack and explained to TAP correspondent, that the deployment of army and security forces in the region have helped destroy several militant groups hideouts, obliging them to move from the locality of ""Jebel Kassar El Klel"" in the south of Mount Ouergha to an area in the north of this mountain chain.

The circulation of people and vehicles across the Ras Jedir border post is almost entirely blocked due to a sit-in in the border town of Ben Guerdane. Protesters continues to demand that the resume of commercial activities and the removal of a border tax.

A pacific march took place in Kairouan after the funeral of one of the soldiers killed in the attack in Kasserine. The protesters blamed the lack of security and vigilance in the mountaineous area where militants operate.

Transport agents unions organised on Thursday a demonstration to express their solidarity with the military forces killed in Kasserine. The sit-in took place in front of the government HQ in La Kasbah.

The circulation of people and vehicles across the Ras Jedir border post is almost entirely blocked due to a sit-in in the border town of Ben Guerdane. Protesters continues to demand that the resume of commercial activities and the removal of a border tax.

Other marches and sit-ins were staged in Beja, Tataouine and Gabes to express concern about the militant attack on police forces in Kasserine and to call for adopting more effective security policies.

Other marches and sit-ins were staged in Beja, Tataouine and Gabes to express concern about the militant attack on police forces in Kasserine and to call for adopting more effective security policies.
A sit-in was staged in front of the security district in Sousse to denounce the conditions of security forces in the aftermath of the Kasserine attack where 4 police officers were killed.

The circulation of people and vehicles across the Ras Jedir border post is almost entirely blocked due to a sit-in in the border town of Ben Guerdane. Protesters continues to demand that the resume of commercial activities and the removal of a border tax. The sit-in was suspended after an agreement with the government, which committed itself to remove the tax for cross-border transit.
Hundreds of people took part in a pacific march promoted by Nidaa Tounes in Tunis to protest against the attack on 4 police officers in Kasserine.

Members of the security forces and civil society organised a street march in Sidi Bouzid, calling for a rapid approval of enhanced security legislation. The participants demanded better equipment, a tougher stance against attacks on posts of police and the families of the officers. They finally condemned the attack perpetrated in Boulaaba last week, which caused 4 deaths among National Guard officers.

Arrests: About one hundred of Tunisians have been arrested in the last three days for preparing armed attacks. Tunisian authorities reported that some of the arrested were also associated with the IS-linked militia Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: A gunfight between national guard officers and militants occurred early on Saturday in the locality of Babouche, in Ain Draham (Jendouba), on the border with Algeria.
Armed units started large ariel bombing and combing operations in the western mountains of the governorate of Kasserine hunting for militants and their hideouts.

An unspecified number of unemployed people in the Gabes governatorate began on Saturday a hunger strike in the local section of the Tunisian League for Human Rights (LTDH). Protesters denounce the predicament in the region and demand better living and working conditions.
Large bombing and combing operations conducted by the army continue on Mount Sammama to track down the militants active in this region.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Tunisian TV
column17: Units of the national army conducted an aerial and artillery bombardment on western Mount Semmama on March 2nd, while specialized units were embedded in the mountain to comb the areas which have been bombarded over the past two days. According to ministerial sources, two militants were killed in the military operations: they are the so-called Hazem Ben Habib Ouertani and Fethi Ben Abdallah Ben Hassine Khelifi.

Students of high schools and colleges of Tunis organised on Monday a march that crossed the streets of the capital city. They protested against the continuation of a strike launched by teachers unions. The march eventually ended outside the HQ of the UGTT in place Mohamed Ali.
A march of protest was staged on March 2nd in Jendouba. Demonstrators demanded the improvement of socio-economic conditions and more effective development policies.

Weapons Seizure: Tunisian security forces on Monday uncovered a second arms cache in three days 15 kilometres (nine miles) from Ben Guerdane, near the border with Libya. The cache included 20 rocket-propelled grenade launchers and various types of rockets, 40 anti-tank mines, detonators, grenades and 23,000 rounds of assault rifle ammunition. A similar find was made in the same area on Friday.

A group of workers have staged a peaceful sit-in since March 9th in front of the entrance of the oil company Petrofac. They demand the regularisation of their job situation and their integration within the oil companies they have been working in for four years. They also denounce that the management of Petrofac has refused to have a dialogue with them.
A group of peasants protested in Monday outside the regional delegation of agriculture in Beja, demanding compensations for the recent floods.
Protest erupted on Tuesday in Dkhilet Toujane, when citizens rallied in the town centre to demand that municipality and a delegation are created and the local hospital becomes operative.

Tunisian security forces fired teargas to disperse a demonstration in the industrial area of Gabes. The protesters, which included peasants and fishermen, organised a sit-in to demand compensations for the damages provoked by industrial pollution.

Gunmen stormed Tunisias National Bardo Museum killing 21 people on Wednesday. 20 of the civilians killed in the Wednesdays attack were foreign tourists, most of them from cruise ships. The two gunmen had been killed in a police assault and authorities were hunting for possible accomplices. The gunmen are reported to have been trained by the Islamic State in Tunisia, but it remains unclear whether the group was directly responsible for the attack.

Tuesday's march was marred by lower-than-expected turnout due to heavy rains but several hundred activists, NGO workers, and members of civil society organisations joined in to take a stand in support of peaceful co-existence. Besides, participants also seized the opportunity to express their solidarity with the Saharawi people, demanding the implementation of UN charters that recognize the right of the Saharawi people to self-determination.

column17: Tunisian forces have killed nine men allegedly belonging to the Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade, accused of organising the attack on its national museum, the interior ministry said Sunday. The nine militants of the countries main jihadist group, were killed in the mountainous area of Sidi Aich, in west-central Tunisia. In the military operation, Tunisian forces killed Lokmen Abou Sakher, leader of the Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade that authorities claimed to be behind the March 18 attack on the Bardo Museum.

Tens of thousands of people took to the streets of Tunis on Saturday to oppose globalization under the slogan ""another world is possible."" The demonstration was held as the 12th annual World Social Forum unfolded in the Tunisian capital. The demonstrators showed ""that global trade relations, migration policies and climate justice must adhere to democratic principles and the observation of human rights.""

Some members of the militant group, composed of a dozen of people, were injured, according to military sources. The security forces have also found the truck assaulted by the armed group on Saturday.

President Beji Caid Essebsi inaugurated on the occasion the stele erected in front of the museum in tribute to the victims of the attack. He also thanked the Presidents of France, Poland, Gabon and Palestine, the Italian Prime Minister, the Algerian, Moroccan, Turkish, Emirati and other countries delegations for joining Tunisians in this event.

During the police intervention, agents arrested several participants to the sit-in who protested from a few days outside the HQ of an oil company to demand more jobs. Following the arrests, the angered youths reacted by setting tyres on fires and erecting roadblocks; in response to these actions, the police fired teargas to disperse the demonstrators.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Al Jazeera
column17: Tunisias Ministry of Defence has released pictures of armed men who were reportedly killed in air strikes on Mount Chaambi. A ministry spokesman said that the troops killed 10 gunmen who were among a group of men who attacked a military patrol on Jebel Selloum in April. Military units are currently carrying out combing operations in the mountains, finding 61 camps and mass graves of armed men killed in military offensives. According to Tunisian authorities, militant groups use secrete caches to bury their dead in order to hide the number of victims in their ranks and appear in strong position to mobilise new members. Exact date of deaths unknown.

A military patrol was attacked by a group of 30 armed men in the Tunisian region of Maghila, in Sbeitla, in the Kasserine Governorate. The group encircled a patrol composed of three military vehicles by setting off a landmine then reportedly firing an RPG shell at them, they then started shooting and the soldiers shot back at them"". Five soldiers were killed, which also left eight others injured.

A group of workers have staged a peaceful sit-in since March 9th in front of the entrance of the oil company Petrofac. They demand the regularisation of their job situation and their integration within the oil companies they have been working in for four years. They also denounce that the management of Petrofac has refused to have a dialogue with them.

column17: A sit-in of protests was organised by the students of UGET, by the League of Young Jurists and by the Union of Young Forces (UFJ) outside the Municipal Theatre in Tunis against the arrest of Kais Bouzouzia, a member of UGET executive board and of UFJ as well as against the expulsion of two law students of UFJ.

They also denounce that the management of Petrofac has refused to have a dialogue with them.

A group of imams have staged a protest in the Tunisian capital against what they called ""infringements of their rights"" by the minister of religious affairs. Gathering outside the Ministry of Religious Affairs in Tunis, the preachers raised banners denouncing perceived strict state control of mosques and the governments use of ""the war on terrorism to restrict religious freedom"". They also accused the ministry of ""arbitrary dismissal"" of imams.

A group of workers in a environment company have staged a peaceful sit-in since March 9th in front of the entrance of the oil company Petrofac. They demand the regularisation of their job situation and their integration within the oil companies they have been working in for four years. They also denounce that the management of Petrofac has refused to have a dialogue with them.

The inhabitants in the area of Grayne au Djebel Esserj (delegation of Oueslatia), 60 km from Kairouan, staged a sit-in of protest outside the offices of Oueslatia delegation, to demand that their village can access potable water. The locality has been excluded from potable water supply for three years.
In Kairouan, a group of lawyers organised a movement of protest outside the Tribunal of First Instance to demand the opening of court of appeal in town.

The personnel of Petrofac oil company protested to demand the interruption of a sit-in which has stopped the production for one month. According to the companies labour union, Petrofac is about to quit Tunisia due to the interruption of gas production lasting for more than one month. They demand the regularisation of their job situation and their integration within the oil companies they have been working in for four years. The General Federation of Telecommunications (FGT), a branch of Tunisian General Labour Union (UGTT), staged a a sit-in on Monday outside the Ministry of ICT and DIgital Economy to demand the voice their claims to the autohirities.

A corporal of the National Army was killed, on Wednesday, in clashes between army units and and armed Islamists in Jebel Salloum, in the governorate of Kasserine. The soldier died after that Islamic militants opened fire on a military patrol.

The journalists Samira Souri (Nessma TV), Saida Trabelsi (El Hiwar Ettounsi) and some cameramen were kept hostage for more than thirty minutes by protesters in Om Larayes. The press agents were covering the official visit of a governmental and parliamentary delegation in Gafsa mining basin, which refused to meet with the protesters. The demonstrators demanded an official meeting with the authorities in return for the liberation of the journalists. According to Saida Trabelsi, the whole event lasted for more than half an hour and caused some damages to their vehicle. After negotiations with the protesters, the journalists managed to leave the town and arrive in Gafsa.

Two Tunisian soldiers and 14 presumed Islamists were killed on Thursday in clashes in rugged terrain near the border with Algeria this week. The fighting began Wednesday when Islamic extremists opened fire on a military patrol, killing one soldier. The violence took place near Mount Chaambi, a stronghold of Oqba ibn Nafaa group that has carried out numerous attacks on soldiers and police in the region. No other details were revealed ""in order to preserve the operations secrecy"".

Party members and inhabitants of the delegation of Sidi Ali Ben Aoun (gouvernatorate of Sidi Bouzid) organised on Saturday a peaceful march against militant violence and in support of national institutions and development.

National army units succeeded, late Saturday night, to repulse an armed attack on Mount Mghilla located between the governorates of Kasserine and Sidi Bouzid. No injuries were reported among servicemen

Patrol agents staged a sit-in of protest on Monday outside the general administration of the Tunisian Customs offices. The protesters demanded mainly the reintegration of the fired agents and the activation of bonuses.

column7: UGTT: Tunisian General Labour Union; Health Workers (Tunisia)
column17: Employees in the health sector marched in protest in Tunis to demand greater attention from the government.

Clashes broke out, Wednesday evening, in Tamaghzah between a group of citizens and security forces. The riots took place after the arrest of five people accused of aggression against a policeman. Witnesses affirmed that security forces fired teargas and bullets to disperse the demonstrators, who gathered outside the offices of the delegation and set tyres on fire.

column16: Le Temps (Tunisia); Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: Clashes between citizens and security forces continued on Thursday evening in Tamaghzah, Tozeur. Protesters demand the liberation of five people arrested by the police for an attempted homicide against a policeman.

A landmine exploded, Thursday on Mount Salloum, in the governorate of Kasserine, without causing any human or material losses, said Official Spokesman for the Defence Ministry Lieutenant-Colonel Belhassen Oueslati.

Around 200 people demonstrated on Friday in Tunis to demand truth over the fate of the two Tunisian journalists missing in Libya. The two press agents, Sofiene Chourabi and Nadhir Ktari, were reportedly killed by militants of the Islamic State.
The employees of the company Tunisie Catering protested on Monday outside the Parliament to claim that their company is reintegrated in Tunisair.

Several armed agents of security forces gathered on Monday outside the tribunal of first instance in Tozeur chanting slogans against the magistrates. The agents protested after the incidents that took place the week before in the delegation of Tamaghza. On that occasion, the agents were accused to have violated legal procedures and exceeded in questioning suspects.
Three journalists of the Tunisian newspaper ""Attounissia"" have staged a sit-in to denounce their socio-economic problems.
The second day of a sit-in by journalists to denounce their socio-economic problems.
The magistrates of the tribunal of first instance of Tozeur staged a sit-in in Tozeur to denounce the abuses of security forces in the region.
The third day of a sit-in by journalists to denounce their socio-economic problems.
A protest movement started, Wednesday, in El Faouar to demand hiring of youths of the region in the Dutch company of oil exploration.

column7: SNJT: National Union of Tunisian Journalists
column17: Several journalist of local radio stations gathered in Tunis to demand the regularisation of their professional condition.
On Thursday night, protesters blocked the main roads of El Faouar, setting tyres on fire and throwing stones on the police.
Dozens of employees of Tunisie Telecom staged a sit-in outside the HQ of the company protesting against to protest against the management.
Protests escalated on Saturday, when protesters set the local police station on fire. The protesters accused the police of having been excessive in their use of force on demonstrators.
Demonstrators assaulted some journalists in the midst of unrest in El Faouar (coded separately).
A sit-in was staged by the youth of El Faouar outside the offices of an oil company. Protesters demanded the redistribution of oil revenues.

Four jihadists were killed Thursday in clashes with the Tunisian army in a mountainous region near the border with Algeria. A statement said troops clashed with jihadists at dawn on Mount Sammama near Mount Chaambi, where the army has been battling militants since 2012.

A landmine exploded, Monday on Mount Ouergha in Kef, on the path of a cattle herd without causing victims. A cattle herd entered on Monday evening into a field of landmines planted by militant groups who had been holed up on Mount Ouergha, in the governorate of Kef. National Guard and army units went to the scene to help the shepherd and his cattle leave the landmine field.

Demonstrations took place in several towns in the minerary basin of Gafsa to protest against the lack of industrial policies in the region. Strikes and marches involved the towns of Gafsa, Mdhilla, Metlaoui, Oum Larayes and Redayef, as well as Sned et Sidi Yaich, paralysing commercial and administrative activities.

Security forces fired teargas to disperse members of the Jemna and Kalaa communities who engaged in violent clashes in Kebili over a land dispute.

Some 21 people were injured in Tuesday evenings clash between two communities in Tunisia over a land dispute. Members of the Jemna and Kalaa communities in Southern Tunisia exchanged gunfire and threw stones during the clash. It took a Tunisian army units intervention to end the hostilities.

The countries southwest has been experiencing unrest for the last few months due to a difficult socio-economic situation and increasing unemployment rates.
Police seriously assault a municipal official for unknown reasons. The victim is hospitalised with a broken jaw.
