Police in the delegation of Siliana Sud staged a protest movement in the morning of Thursday to denounce increasing insecurity.
Teachers protested in Beja.
People protested in the region of Mornaguia blocking the national route n.5 against the bad quality of water.

Agreement: The Court of First Instance in Tunis has decided to suspend the activities of Hizb ut-Tahrir for a month from August 15. This comes under the provisions of the law on political parties and associations but also at the request of the Counsel of the State representing the Prime Ministry. The Prime Ministry had repeatedly threatened to dissolve the party by legal means after the June 2015 attack in Sousse.
Algerian drivers blocked the border passage of Sakiet Sidi Youssef in Tunisia after the introduction of a new tax for foreign vehicles enterring Tunisian territory.
Looting: A group of armed militants operating across the border with Algeria robbed a civilian house and seized food, weapons and mobile phones. A combing operation was launched soon after by police.
Police intervened in Sousse province, near a tyre factory, to disperse an ongoing sit-in. The intervention took place after repeated disruption to the circulation of vehicles.
Young people staged a march from Meknassi to Sidi Bouzid to protest the recruitment process in the phosphate basin nearby.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Mosaique FM

Taxi drivers organised a protested in Jendouba.
Substitute teachers protested in Beja and demanded the regolarisation of their professional situation.

Three armed militants were injured in clashes with the army on Jebel Ouargha. A combing operation was ongoing in the area. A soldier was injured in a separate event when a landmine exploded in the same mountainous area.
A man authorities described as Salafist stabbed a police officer in Ben Arous. The officer was hospitalised and the militant arrested.

column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; African Manager
column17: The supply of phosphate to Tunisian Chemical Group (GCT) plants, including Medhilla, Gabes and Sfax is blocked after a new wave of protest by unemployed graduates, especially in various phosphate production sites and distribution channels in Metlaoui. Protesters among university graduates from the delegation of Metlaoui have staged since Saturday a sit-in in several phosphate production sites and at the railway station in the city center causing a suspension of phosphate transportation through locomotives to chemical fertilisers production units in Gabes, Medhilla, Skhira and Sfax.

Three soldiers were killed when a group of Okba Ibn Nafaa militants attacked a military convoy in Jebel Semmama using explosives, RPG and kalashnikovs. The soldiers were killed while on patrol in the mountainous region. On the same day, at least two militants were injured in subsequent shootouts. The Ministry reported that the militants were fatally hit, although it could not confirm the episode.

column16: African Manager; AFP; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: Phosphate production is stopped in Metlaoui after protests staged by unemployed from Gafsa on Monday and Tuesday.

Two suspected jihadists were killed in a nighttime raid by security forces in the Kasserine region of Tunisia that also left a civilian dead. A gun battle on Tuesday night between security forces and the suspects holed up in a house lasted several hours, and that the civilian was hit by shots fired by the jihadists. Among the suspects, the Ministry recognised Jihed Mbarki, affiliated to Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade.
Tunisian military bombed Jebel Semmama, in attempt of attacking militant positions in the area.
Another sit-in was reported in menzel Bouaiene. The protesters are unemployed claiming jobs in the local phosphate basin.

Hundreds of people in the northwestern Tunisian town of Fernana stage a protest rally against widespread poverty and growing unemployment, September 13, 2016. Demonstrators set ablaze tires and set up blockades in the roads leading to the town of Fernana, in Jendouba Province, on Tuesday, two days after a young man self-immolated in protest at unemployment in the town.

As the process against the leadership of Hizb Tahrir Party started in Tunis, protesters gathered outside a tribunal in the capital city.

column17: Civil society organisations, including UGET, organised a rally in Place de la Kasbah demanding the implementation of an agreement signed by the government to refund people assaulted by the police.
Public sector workers staged a protest rally in Jendouba demanding the application of earlier accords between the government and the unions.
Following the death of a child during floods, residents protested burning tyres and blocking vehicles in Sousse.
A group of rioting residents from Bou Aoun in Sidi Bouzid kidnapped two officials of the Tunisian Electricity and Gas Company and held them throughout the day of Tuesday.
Riots erupted near Sfax where villagers blocked the national route linking Sfax to Gabes to protest the death of a teenager in a car accident.

column7: UGET: General Union of Tunisian Students
column17: Former UGET students protested in Bizerte demanding employment.
Unemployed youth broke into the governorate of Kasserine and threatened collective suicide. Police intervened to restore order.
Farmers protested in Le Kef urging the government to take action against the damages produced by natural catastrophes and drought.

Protesters have shut down two key Tunisian phosphate mines in a weeks-long dispute over jobs. Production and transport of phosphates has been totally halted since yesterday (Friday) at the Metlaoui site because of demonstrations by dozens of unemployed who stopped a bus carrying workers from entering the site. Protesters also prevented trucks carrying phosphate from leaving another site at Mdhilla, 15 kilometres (10 miles) to the south, where production had been halted for a week

A number of political parties and civil society organisation took part in a march in central Tunis to protest the invasion of Palestine.
Residents of Jemmal took to the streets after the visit of PM Chahed in town.
Protests took place in Tataouine on Monday. These anticipated a planned strike, which was subsequently cancelled.
An Olympic athlete has started a sit-in the offices of the Ministry of Youth and Sports to demand his recruitment as professor of physical education.
The workers of a tyres factory in Msaken staged a protest march to demand their salaries.
The circulation of vehicles was interrupted between Siliana and Kairouan as residents of El Kantra burnt tyres.

Several residents in the delegation of Belhir took part in a general strike to protest the growing marginalisation of their region. During the protests, the road linking Gafsa with Gabes was interrupted.
Protests continued in Msaken as demonstrators burnt tyres on the road outside the STIP factory.
A protest demonstration was held in Ksour Essaf, Mahdia, against a proposed trade bill.

Students blocked the circulation of vehicles outside the Rgueda campus between Kairouan and the Tunisian south. A sit-in took place early in October in the same place. No report of the erection of barricades
The army bombarded the Mount Birinou near Kasserine after reports that armed militants are hiding in the locality.
Clothes traders protested in Sfax.
A group of unemployed graduates staged a protest in the port of Sidi Youssef in the island of Kerkennah, preventing trucks carrying gas from reaching the Petrofac company.
The circulation of vehicles was interrupted on the road between Gafsa and Sidi Bouzid, at Om Laadham point, as farmers from Bir el Bay were burning tyres to protest being ignored by the authorities.

Twenty political parties and civil society organisations, on Saturday, staged a demonstration at Habib Bourguiba Avenue, calling for restoring ties with Syria and ending foreign interference in the Syrian conflict.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: A group of armed men attempted to target a National Guard security post in Ain Khmouda, located in the delegation Foussana, Kasserine governorate. The security officers detected and opened fire on the group who returned fire before running away in the direction of nearby Jebel Semmama. No injuries or damages were recorded in the ranks of the National Guard.
Police used teargas to disperse protesters in Metlaoui, Gafsa governorate The rally was organised to protest the arrest of a person.

Journalists of Radio Kelma staged a sit-in outside the offices of their radio in Tunis to demand the disboursement of their salaries. On the same, garbace collectors in Tunis entered on strike demanding the regularisation of their professional positions.
Students of an high school in Bir Lahfay protested and burnt tyres in the central roads of the town near Sidi Bouzid. They demanded that potable water and electricity are installed in their school.

column16: Al Arabiya; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse
column17: Thousands of Tunisian lawyers went on strike on Friday to protest at new taxes and tighter fiscal controls on their profession, extending a series of demonstrations against austerity measures in the 2017 budget. Several hundred attorneys held a symbolic protest outside the palace of justice in downtown Tunis where, dressed in their court gowns, they chanted ""Down down with the shameful law"" and ""We are united in the fight"". A new three-day strike was launched a month later on 29 November.
Fishermen demonstrators on the island of Kerkennah on Saturday during the visit of the Agriculture Minister Samir Ettaeib. The sit-in took place in the port of Sidi Youssef.
A mine exploded near Jebel Semmama, Sbeitla province. No injuries were reported.

The association of mothers of missing Tunisians in Italy staged, on Friday, a protest outside the headquarters of the Prime Ministry in Kasbah, to ask the government to clarify the fate of their missing children in Italy for 6 years and take the necessary measures to repatriate them.
Seven taxi drivers attempted suicide in Sidi Bouzid demanding the release of licenses.
Residents from Chaala locality protested in Sfax over administrative issues.

A soldier was killed in his own house by a group of at least four Islamist militants in Sbiba region. He tried to react to the attack but was overtaken by the militants. The chief of the IS-linked Jund Al Khilafa group was killed during a military operation in Jebel Selloum.

Other: In an act of protest, a police officer set himself on fire in Kasserine. He was saved and hospitalised in Ben Arous.
The staff of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs staged a sit-in and a strike on Friday outside the offices of the Ministry.
Journalists of Hannibal TV staged a sit-in on Thursday outside the offices of their channel. They protested the failed payment of salaries.

Weapons Seizure: Tunisian authorities have discovered five arms caches in the south of the country near the border with war-ravaged Libya and seized large quantities of weapons.Two were found Saturday near the city of Ben Guerdane, a third on Sunday and two more on Monday also in the same region. the biggest find was made Sunday, in a garage on the outskirts of Ben Guerdane where 50 guns, including 27 Kalashnikov assault rifles, and dozens of missiles were confiscated. Authorities also seized 30 crates of ammunition as well as 12 kilograms (26.4 pounds) of explosives and more than 1,000 tasers
Two landmines exploded on Jebel Mghilla on Monday. The first one hit a military convoy injuring 2 soldiers.
Two landmines exploded on Jebel Mghilla on Monday. The second one hit a military convoy injuring 8 people near Ain Jafal locality.
The family of a man who died during riots in 2011 blocked National Route 14 (Jendouba - Ain Draham - Tabarka) demanding truth over the death of their relative.
Border agents protested outside the local administration demanding pay rise.
A conference of the Instance for Truth and Dignity was interrupted in Tunis as protesters broke into the hall demanding the creation of a repayment fund.
Car hirers protested in Moncef Bey locality in Tunis.

Tunisians have expressed their anger after a child was forced to marry her 20-year-old relative who allegedly raped her on multiple occasions, resulting in her falling pregnant. A court in Kef, northeast of the country, issued a decision last week granting leniency to the perpetrator on the condition of his marriage to the girl. Protests in Tunis and Le Kef were organized last Wednesday in response.

A court in Kef, northeast of the country, issued a decision last week granting leniency to the perpetrator on the condition of his marriage to the girl. Protests in Tunis and Le Kef were organized last Wednesday in response.

Palestinian Islamist group Hamas said Saturday a Tunisian engineer murdered in the North African country was one of its leaders, accused Israel of the killing and vowed to avenge him. Mohamed Zaouari, a 49-year-old engineer, was murdered at the wheel of his car outside his house in Tunisias second city, Sfax, on Thursday. At least five people were detained in relation to the murder.
Taxi drivers protested in Sfax and demanded that the authorities respect the agreements with the unions.

Corrals workers in Sidi Bouzid closed today roads that link between different regions, as well as the closure of many of the service-and financial institutions to protest against salary delay for the month of November.

Hundreds protested in Tunis on Tuesday over the murder of a Tunisian engineer last week that Palestinian Islamist movement Hamas has blamed on Israel. Waving Tunisian and Palestinian flags, more than 200 protesters walked up a main thoroughfare in the Tunisian capital. Several organisations and political parties took part in the demonstration.
A sit-in was organised outside the tribunal of Le Kef to protest the decision of the tribunal over a marriage involving a child.
A group of citizens of Ben Gardane staged a sit-in outside the administration offices. They tried to raise attention on another protest sit-in near Ben Gardan ongoing for nearly three weeks.
Another demonstration was organised in Sfax by civil society organisations to commemorate the assassination of Mohamed Zouari.

People gathered in protest in Mohamedia to denounce the failed construnction of a cultural institute in their town.
Citizens of Jelma protested against the deterioration of the hospital in town.

African students gathered Sunday afternoon in front of the Municipal Theatre at the Habib Bourguiba Avenue in Tunis, to denounce the aggressions against them in Tunisia. They were dozens of protesters who shouted slogans denouncing violence and racism and calling on Tunisia to protect them. This protest was staged in reaction to the attack on Saturday against three Congolese students (two girls and a boy). The two girls were wounded in a knife attack in the city centre at the Place de la Republique (better known as Le Passage).

A group of protesters who have staged a sit-in outside Ben gardane marched in protest outside the Regional labour Union in Medenine. They demand effective measures to tackle the problems of the region.
A shepherd and his son were injured in a landmine explosion near Kasserine. The father died of his wounds in the hospital later.

About 1,000 people protested in central Tunis on Sunday against allowing Tunisians who had fought with jihadists abroad back into the country. Protesters at Sunday's rally -- many wrapped in Tunisians flags -- shouted ""No to returning terrorists!"" and ""All Tunisians against terrorism!""
A pacific march took place in Kasserine, organised by civil society associations and youths. They demanded development and jobs.

Gunshots were fired across the Tunisian - Libyan border in the area of Remada. No Tunisian soldiers were injured.

Clashes erupted on Wednesday in Tunisia's border town of Ben Guerdane between police and protesters demanding the free flow of vital trade with neighbouring Libya. Protesters set fire to tyres and blocked the road between Ben Guerdane and the border crossing of Ras Jedir about 30 kilometres (20 miles) away. They gathered outside official buildings in Ben Guerdane and security forces intervened after they were targeted by stone-throwers.

column7: UGTT: Tunisian General Labour Union; UTICA: Tunisian Confederation of Industry, Trade and Handicrafts
column17: More than a thousand people demonstrated Tuesday in the southern Tunisian city of Tataouine during a general strike to denounce marginalisation and demand development and jobs. The city some 500 kilometres (200 miles) south of Tunis on the edge of the desert has been the scene of several protests over the past fortnight. On Tuesday, cafes, shops and public buildings closed, although pharmacies, bakeries and hospitals remained open. Demonstrators chanted slogans including ""Employment is a right, not a favour"" and ""No to the decline of our rights"". UGTT and UTICA supported the strike.

Protesters, who rallied outside the Tunis Municipal Theatre, reaffirmed their categorical opposition to the draft law on reconciliation, saying it violates, in many respects, the Constitution, the Transitional Justice Act and the process of establishing the truth.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column16: Maghreb Emergent; Xinhua; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Al Jazeera
column17: Two armed militants, including a suicide bomber, were killed in a security operation by special forces of the National Guard in Ouled Chebli district of Sidi Bouzid. Another five were captured, but release without charge the following day. The militants were allegedly planning a terrorist attack during the month of Ramadan. One was a commander with the Okba Ibn Nafaa militia.
Protesters marched in Gabes to denounce the government's draft law on financial reconciliation.

Protesters moved their sit-in closer to the headquarters of the Perenco oil company in Douz. They have been calling for a better use of extraction revenues for development in the region by holding a sit in around El Golaa since 29 April.

Protesters devastated the offices of the delegation of Mellouleche in Mahdia and burnt tyres on the road to prevent traffic. Their action lasted until 1 May, when a compromise was found with authorities and road access was restored.

Protesters staged an open sit-in action over three days in Hazoua (governorate of Tozeur) to protest regional authorities' failure to meet the calls of local people on employment and development. Their action prevented access on roads leading to the border post of Hazoua.
Peaceful march in Sidi Bouzid to denounce terrorism.
Taxi drivers in Tozeur protested in front of the governorate's headquarters over permit allocation.
Youth in Dh'hiba protested in support of sit-iners in El Kamour, calling for better employment opportunities and development in the region. Road access was blocked as a result.

Protesters burnt tyres and set up other road blocks on the road crossing Kairouan village. They also took hostage a bus of school children. Their action aimed at calling authorities on preventing students' harassment in front of high schools in the region.
A mine explosion on Jbel Sammema mount in Sbeitla, Kasserine province, left a military officer injured.
Residents of the Safsaf estate in Bir Bouragba protested on the national road 1, calling for better public services linked to water, sanitation and road construction.
Public institution workers closed offices and staged a sit-in within a local delegate's office in Feriana to call for better social coverage.
Security forces' syndicates in Medenine protested two days in a row in front of the forces' headquarters to call for rights related to the Ben Guerden battle.
A group of unemployed people and civil society activists marched in Haidra calling for better employment opportunities and development.
Unknown assailants vandalised the offices of the Al Joumhouri party in Ariana. Party members denounced it as an intimidation act.

Thousands protested in northeastern Tunisia on Thursday to mark a general strike over unemployment and poverty, six years since a revolution ignited by similar grievances. Demonstrators gathered at the local branch of the powerful UGTT trade union in Kef, 180 kilometres west of Tunis, before marching down the main streets.
People marched in Kairouan calling on authorities to give the death penalty to a criminal who raped a woman in the town. The woman died of her injuries.
31 women with secondary and higher education started a sit-in one month ago to demand employment. They ask to be employed in the public sector.

Security forces' syndicates in Medenine protested two days in a row in front of the forces' headquarters to call for rights related to the Ben Guerden battle. On 5 May, the Director of the Houch Dar cultural centre in Medenine also began a hunger strike to protest lack of financial means in the sector.
Opposition supporters marched in Gafsa to denounce the government's draft law on financial reconciliation.

A number of unemployed post graduates in Kasserine province organized an open sit in front of the regional branch of the Agriculture Commission and the National Guard Center to protest lack of employment by local and regional authorities. One of the protesters threatened to commit collective suicide if they continue to delay the demands of the protesters.
Attendees of the Junior Chamber International Africa & Middle East Conference staged a peace march in Sousse under the sign ""peace is possible"".
Youth from Dguech delegation began a sit-in on Chott el-Jerid square in Tozeur to protest lack of employment by one company (Sotusl) and tough legal procedures to invest in the region.

Inhabitants from Tataouine and protesters from Kamour organized a demonstration at the ""Place du peuple"" to insist on their demand. They said that the sit-in will continue until their demands are met.
Unemployed Tunisians from Hydra blocked the road that leads to the Tebessa province in Algeria. They threatened to seek refuge in Algeria if development stalls further.
Inhabitants from Kssour Sef prevented trucks from the municipality to bring the region'#s waste to El-Madama storage place.
The inhabitants of Bouchemma chased away the governor of Gabes. The demonstrators currently protest against pollution from a chemical company. They furthermore blocked route 1.
Two young protesters set themselves on fire during the sit-in in front of the petroleum fields in Sidi Kilani. They were both transferred to the hospital in Mahdia
Unemployed inhabitants from Thala blocked the main road to demand employment and agricultural micro-credits.
Inhabitants fropm Sidi Bouzid marched today against terrorism and praised the security forces.
Protesters at Dehiba stopped demonstrating and ceased from blocking the border post.

The armed forces pushed back rioters trying to invade the gas-pumping station GPL that leads from Algeria to Italy. A sit-in that prevents workers to access the site took place during the last two weeks.
The inhabitants of Bouchemma blocked the road leading to the industrial companies.

Around 100 workers of the institution ""Inoplast"" plastic industry protested against the failure to achieve a number of their professional demands and not being able to require their right to belong to a trade union by the management of their company. They furthermore demand adherence to occupational health and safety standards.

A man self-immolated himself and was transferred to the hospital. His friends blocked the road and set fire to the local delegation. The polices forces intervened to disperse the rioters and liberate the roads.
Protesters stopped with their sit-in in Chott el-Jerid after an agreement between protesters and tlocal representatives was concluded.
Protesters stopped with their sit-in in Souassi after an agreement between protesters and the petroleum company was concluded.
People went to the streets to repudiate the speech of president Essebsi. The protesters invoke their right to development and are condemning the dispersing of sit-ins by security forces.
Young people in Douz protested after president Essebsi announced the deployment of military forces to protect phosphate and petroleum zones in the South.
Young people in Goaa near Douz protested after president Essebsi announced the deployment of military forces to protect phosphate and petroleum zones in the South.
Arrests: A new security campaign led to the arrest of 491 searched individuals.
Protesters in Sebitla suspended their sit-in after concluding an agreement with the governor.
Protesters in Hidra suspended their sit-in after finding an agreement with the local delegate. The border post to Algeria is now open again.
Civil society activists demonstrated in front of the court of appeals.

More than 2,000 Tunisians protested Saturday in the capital against a bill that would allow officials being prosecuted for alleged corruption to be amnestied in exchange for reimbursing embezzled funds.""Corruption will not pass!"" shouted demonstrators including prominent politicians in central Tunis, after a call to protest from more that 50 non-government organisations and a group dubbed ""Manich Msamah"" (""I don't forgive"" in Arabic).
Inhabitants of Helba in Tozeur, organized a demonstration to call for an improvement of local infrastructure and public institutions.

Journalists and civil society representatives prorested in order to short solidarity with their colleague and president of the Tunisian Union of Media Associations Salam Malik who was condemned to 6 months in prison.
Unemployed alumni protested and shut down the municipality, post and regional representation.

Several young disabled people coming from different regions of the country staged a sit-in outside the Municipal Theatre in Tunis, protesting in sign language against the non-application of Article 48 of the Tunisian Constitution which guarantees the rights to work and free care.

Journalists and civil society representatives prorested in order to short solidarity with their colleague and president of the Tunisian Union of Media Associations Salam Malik who was condemned to 6 months in prison.

Journalists and civil society representatives prorested in order to short solidarity with their colleague and president of the Tunisian Union of Media Associations Salam Malik who was condemned to 6 months in prison.
Protesters in El Faouar organized a sit-in in front of the oil companies (Perenco).
Some protesters started a sit-in near a central gaz-tap to continue protesting against unemployment and for a fair share of oil income. The rest of them dissolved their earlier sit-in.
Street hawkers demonstrated in front of the police post in Al Halfaouine to demand the liberation of their colleague.
Protesters in Skhira tried to close the gas-taps in Skhira. Their advance was prevented by the army that is stationed there to protect them.
Protesters in Al Goola closed the gas-taps of the Perenco enterprise in order to show their solidarity with the protesters in El Fouar and Douz.

Protesters demonstrated in front of the hospital in Kasserine and then blocked the crossroads in Ezzouhour with burned tires. They were protesting against the demise of a baby in a Hospital in Kasserine.

Protesters demonstrated in front of the hospital in Kasserine and then blocked the crossroads in Ezzouhour with burned tires. They were protesting against the demise of a baby in a Hospital in Kasserine.
The syndicate of the agents of the general directory of security called for a meeting in front of the interior ministry and claim better working conditions.
Unemployed alumni protested in front of the citizen's office in Jendouba. The security forces attacked them while they were waging a sit-in.
Omdas (Sheikhs) from different parts of Tunisia came together in Tunisia to demand the promulgation of a law that regulates their status and improves their financial situation.
Clashes reported to have taken place between army units & armed militants at Jebel Mghila. More precisely in Douar Khraifiya/Thmad where ISIS militants on Nov 5, 2016 killed soldier Said Ghozlani

Rioters in Tunisia on Saturday attacked and shut down an oil and gas installation. Earlier, soldiers twice fired warning shots into the air on Saturday to stop demonstrators from storming the El Kamour gas and oil pumping station.
Rioters shut down a gas & oil installation in Chekika, Douz, to protest against their exclusion from negotiations.
Young Tunisians blocked the Dehiba-Wazen border crossing with Libya on the Tunisian side. Some others broke into the customs-depot and stole cars.

Taxi drivers started a 3-day strike, protesting against police behaviour on the streets. In Tunis they blocked the Moncef Bey road, causing traffic jams. They suspended the strike on the second day. On the same day Two protests were held in Tunis, with demonstrators echoing the rallying cry of Tataouine residents and chanting: ""We won't give up!"" The demonstrators protested against French oil companies and demanded ""the nationalisation of oil resources and the expulsion of foreign companies"", considering that they ""exploit and impoverish the State"".
Inhabitants in Jomna protested to show solidarity with the protesters in Tataouine. They also blocked the street with burning tires.
Inhabitants in Medenine protested to show solidarity with the protesters in Tataouine. The protests later turned violent, with protesters and police clashing on the streets.

A young protester was killed Monday after a national guard vehicle ""accidentally"" ran him over. The death comes as tensions have risen between protesters and security forces outside the El Kamour oil and gas pumping station.Protesters have been camping outside the desert installation in the Tataouine region for around a month, blocking trucks from entering, to demand a share of local resources and priority for jobs in the sector.Security forces fired tear gas at demonstrators in El Kamour on Monday as they tried to storm the facility. The headquarters of the national guard in Tataouine was torched and security forces vehicles set ablaze. Several people were hospitalized. The National Guard forces moved back to the barracks after the riots in El Kamour.

column9: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Residents staged a protest in support of the El-Kamour sit-in. Clashes erupted outside the Tataouine governor's office. Several people were hospitalized.

column9: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Inhabitants in Kebili protested to show solidarity with the protesters in Tataouine. The protests later turned violent, with protesters and police clashing on the streets.
People waged a sit-in in Bir el Hafey to protest against unemployment and bureaucratic problems.
Inhabitants in Souk Lahad protested to show solidarity with the protesters in Tataouine. They also blocked the street with burning tires.
People protested against the use of force by the police in El Kamour.
Protests were reported in Douz, Kalaa and Fouar, where the demonstrators created a regional committee in support of the Tataouine demonstrations.
Protests were reported in Douz, Kalaa and Fouar, where the demonstrators created a regional committee in support of the Tataouine demonstrations.

Inhabitants of El Faouar entered into a general strike. A peaceful march took place in front of the local governmental representation. Protesters demand employment and development. They also want to show solidarity with other protesters in Tataouine. Moreover the protesters closed the gaz-taps from the Perenco and Winstar companies.
Inhabitants of Tozeur went to the streets to show solidarity with the protesters in El Kamour.
Rioters who tried to set the border post at Hazoua on fire clashed with security forces. Some policemen were injured.
The border post at Dehiba Wazen it still blocked by protesters.
People in Gafsa protested to show solidarity with the protesters in Tataouine and to denounce the use of force by security forces.
35 unemployed women waged a sit-in to invoke employment.
Dozens of protesters came together in front of the regional hospital in Tataouine to attend the funeral march for the killed protester.
A demonstration took place today to invoke the support of the medical sector as no specialist was found during the last two weeks.
Protesters went to the street to march towards the local security institution, appealing them not to be drawn to violent behaviour.
Several people gathered in front of the governmental palace in Tunis to show their solidarity for the campaign of the government against corruption.
Unemployed gathered in front of the regional hospital and prevented medical equipment from being transferred to the hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column16: Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; Menastream; Asharq AlAwsat
column17: The National Guard reportedly killed two armed militants, wounded another one and captured four more amidst ambush in Hassi El Frid, Kasserine.The MOI confirms killing of suspected #ISIS/Jund al-Khilafah leader.
Report that the Tunisian army has been shelling Jund al-Khilafah stronghold Jebel Mghila citing eyewitnesses in Jelma.
Clashes between military patrol and armed militants reported early at Jebel Semmama, AK & 2 mags seized.
Agricultural workers blocked the road with burned tires due to protest against their difficulty of working during Ramadan.
Workers from a hotel in Djerba organized a sit-in in front of the hotel to demand the outstanding salary for the last 6 months.
The sit-in in Tataouine continued. Young people are asking for jobs and an improvement of their general situation.
Rioters from among the protesters in El-Kamour invaded the office of the hospital director of Remada and forced him to go back home while also harrasssing him and his family at his private home.
In Al-Hama, a number of activists and resistance activists organized a sit-in demanding the return of security to the governorate.
ISIS/Jund al-Khilafah claimed the killing of a young shepherd that was kidnapped earlier at Jebel Mghila, Sidi Bouzid.
Public health employees protested today against taxi-drivers that slow-down public transport buses which they need to go to work.
Partisans of the front populaire came together in front of the municipal theatre to protest against the killing of Khalifa Soltani by militants.

Inhabitants of Douar Esslatnia participated in the funeral of the recently killed Khelifa Soltani. They chased away the governor of Sidi Bouzid and a delegate of Jelma as soon as they arrived to participate.
Environmental protection associations and civil society activists demonstrated against a company that channels away its phosphogypsum into the sea in Gabes.

Inhabitants of Sidi El Kilani blocked circulation on the road connecting Mahdia to Kairouan with burning tires. They demand the application of contracts signed between inhabitants, authorities and the oil company.
Citizen in his 20's assaulted by #SIS militants after refusing to provide direction & info on army positions around Jebel Mghila.

Employees from the judiciary sector continued with their sit-in to protest against the worsening of their financial situation and working conditions, after the ministry suspended all talks to solve the situation.
Inhabitants of Tataouine organised a peaceful march to protest against recent declarations by the labor minister.
Agreement: Judicial authorities decided to suspend all activities of Hizb ut-Tahrir for one year, amongst other reasons for incitement to hatred.
Protesters blocked the border post Haidra-Tebessa to demand the application of a signed agreement, notable micro-credits and implementation of public projects in the region.
Clashes between inhabitants from Bechni and Jersin villages led to 36 injured, among them one policeman.
Taxi drivers wage a sit-in in front of the local representation in the governorate. They demand that the governor sticks to his promises.
Protesters blocked the border post Haidra-Tebessa to demand the application of a signed agreement, notable micro-credits and implementation of public projects in the region.
2 soldiers wounded in IED/mine blast at Jebel Mghila, Sidi Bouzid.
78 persons were injured as clashes between tribes from the two villages of Bechni and Jersine continued. They were using hunting rifles, stones and other throwable objects.
A soldier from the TAF was injured by a mine explosion. He later died of his injuries. The soldier was part of a group that searched for hostile militants.
A mine exploded under a military verhicle in Jebel Lela Aicha (Kef) during a patrol - without causing injuries. Further details are unclear.
Movement of forces: Military and security forces were deployed between the villages of Bechni and Jersine to prevent further clashes between inhabitants of the two cities.
Unemployed youth closed roads and ceased some cars from a phosphate company. They demand being employed by the company without passing a test.
Dozens of Tunisians demonstrated Sunday in Tunis to demand the right to eat and drink in public during the Muslim fasting month of Ramadan and to protest against non-fasters being arrested.

A number of workers at the Tunisian Sugar Company gathered at the headquarters of the Regional Labour Union in Beja to protest against the Tunisian Trade Bureau's decision to stop marketing suger product.
People in Douz, el Faouar and el Golaa waged a sit-in to claim development and employment.
Tunisia: 2 armed militants on motorbike reportedly managed to return towards Jebel Salloum after exchanging fire with the security patrol.
Tunisia: TAF aborted smuggling attempt & subjected to gunfire by ""escort"" in MBZ/#Tataouine, 2 arrested, AK, grenade, ammo & fuel seized.
People in Douz, el Faouar and el Golaa waged a sit-in to claim development and employment.
People in Douz, el Faouar and el Golaa waged a sit-in to claim development and employment.
Lwayers in Tajerouine protested to demand that their clients be examined by a forensic pathologist.
Exchange of gunfire between TAF unit and armed smugglers in Ain el Bagra on the border with Libya on Tuesday morning.
Security Measures: Tunisia has extended for another four months a state of emergency in place since a 2015 jihadist attack, the president's office announced on Wednesday.

Pupils demonstrated against inconsistencies in the economics and management-exam in front of the Ministry of Education in Tunis. On the same day, some workers from Qatar National Bank went on a strike because of their non-satisfaction with their professional situation.
Inhabitants of Dhouaher region blocked the road from Kairouan to Nasrallah with burning tires. They demand the reparation of an electric generator.
Postal workers in Tastour protested against aggressions which they are facing from clients.
A shepherdess was wounded in IED/mine blast this morning at Jebel Salloum, Kasserine. She later succumbed to her wounds at the Kasserine Regional Hospital.

Agreement: The government of Tunisia with the support of the UGTT reached an agreement with the protesters in the South of the country, ending a month-long blockade caused through sit-ins and demonstrations. Sit-inners in Oued el Kamour said that tents will stay in place until the points of the agreement are actually implemented.

Several workers gathered at the container transit office in the port of Rades and protested against the transfer of a colonel to office number 47, following a decision by the head of government Youssef Chahed. Then they struck and voiced their intention not to levy customs.
Supporters of football ""Club Africain"" demonstrated in front of the regional court in Ben Arous where 2 of their supporters are being sued.
Bakery owners protested in front of the UTICA offices to demand the payment of the debts by the ministry and payment of salaries.

Members of the Union of Agricultural Engineers organized a protest rally today, 20 June 2017, in front of the parliament in Bardo to protest against a new law that aims to restructure the agricultural sector.

The sit-inners of Douz closed yesterday 20 June 2017, a pumping valve of the company Perenco as well as the valve of the Gas in the region of Oum Chieh in the desert of Douz. The sit-inors granted the regional authorities three days to hold a dialogue session to discuss the claims of the inhabitants of the region.

Clashes occurred on the evening of Wednesday 21 June between street vendors and agents of the Sahel transport company in Bab Bhar in Sousse. The clashes broke out after the a guard was aggressed by a street vendor. The security units intervened and used tear gas to disperse the crowd. Security reinforcements were deployed.

Clashes in the town of Bir Lahfey, governorate of Sidi Bouzid, between young people and the police took place. One policeman died of the injuries he suffered during the confrontation. The inhabitants of the region are angry after the death of one of their own in a brawl at the weekly market. The 23-year-old was fatally stabbed to the heart after a dispute with a group of youngsters. Clashes broke out between Awled Youssef and the Frechiches. The police intervened to disperse the crowd. Currently tires are on fire in several streets of the city and clashes are underway with the police.

One young guy died in a brawl at the weekly market. The 23-year-old was fatally stabbed to the heart after a dispute with a group of youngsters. Clashes broke out between Awled Youssef and the Frechiches. The relatives of the deceased took revenge by setting fire to two dwellings belonging to the opposing group.
Representatives of civil society and members of the PRA participated in a sit-in in La Marsa. All have denounced the proliferation of anarchic constructions and the disrespect towards green spaces.
Inhabitants of the town of Metline in the governorate of Bizerte protested on 26 June 2017 to condemn the kidnapping and murder of a child a few days before.
The child of a man who works for the national security services was found dead near the house of its parents. It is most probable that the child was killed because of the work of his father.
A number of sit-inners in Douz in the governorate of Kebili closed the pumping station at the level of the Boulahbel region in the Douz desert.

Inspite of the high temperatures and snakes, some protesters in Oued el Kamour decided to puruse their sit-in. They demand the application of the latest treaty that was signed between them and the government.

In light of a security campaign in Ariana one seller threw Molotov cocktails on the forces before trying to immolate himself. Security Forces managed to deal with the situation and brought the rioters to the next police station.
The family of a young guy who was arrested by the police attacked the police station using stones et al. Two policemen were injured during the clashes.
Policemen protested in Kebili to denounce the killing of their colleague in Bir Lehfey the week before.
Farmers from Jendouba blocked the roads in front of the seat of the local government to protest against water cuts.

Shop owners of street shops in Tunis organized a protest in front of the governorate seat in Tunis. They demand a place where they could work as the security forces are currently removing all unallowed street shops.
Rioters invaded the seat of the local government in Sbiba and damaged some cars. The police used teargas to disperse the rioters and arrested 8 of them.
Several rioters enterned the local governorate seat by force and stole some equipment, according to the delegate of Menzel Bouzyana. One of the rioters repudiated the claim.

A clash between residents of the village of Aliouat and employees of the delegation of Jelma on Friday at the headquarters of the delegation, caused thirteen wounded. The inhabitants of Aliouat came to demand the restoration of electricity in their village. Discussions escalated between staff and protestors who verbally and physically assaulted three employees, ransacked equipment and threatened to burn the premises. The assaulted employees called their relatives to help them, which led to a general fight.

Several residents of the town of Dahmani in the Kef governorate blocked the train to the capital at the city station. The inhabitants demonstrated against the decision of the national railway company to cancel the voyages aboard the express train between Tunis and Kalaat Khasba.
Demonstrators in Gabes protested against the channelling of chemical substances into the sea.
Military units fired heavy artillery fire at positions suspected of harboring terrorist elements at Mount Chaambi in Kasserine governorate.

The inhabitants of the Ouedi Beja village of the Sidi Alouane delegation in the governorate of Mehdia burnt tyres to block the road leading to El Jem on Sunday 2 July 2017 to express their anger after drinking water cuts that lasted for more than a week .

column7: UGTT: Tunisian General Labour Union; Manich Msemah
column17: Protesters went to the streets to demand emloyment. UTGG, civil society and people from the movement Manich Msamah took part in the protest.
In light of the non-fullfilment of the promises by the government, protesters in Douz decided to escalate and totally close the gas-taps transferring gas from the region
Sit-inners in Menzel Bouzaiane in front of the seat of the delegation started a hunger strike. They invoke their right to employment and are waging the sit-in for approximately now 3 months.
The convoy of the governor of Bizerte was prevented access to Rafraf beach by protesters.

Violent clashes erupted Monday morning between illegal merchants on the road at Al Kherba Square on Al Jazeera Street and law enforcement agencies to prevent them from occupying public space. Rioters threw stones while the police answered with teargas. 47 rioters were arrested.
Several workers of the cable factory of the Kef cars began an open sit-in at the governorate headquarters. This Sit-in was organized following the closure of the plant for economic reasons.

The hospital in Kairouan was vandalized. Two families from different tribes sacked almost everything in the hospital. The event followed the death of a member of one of the two belligerent families en route to the hospital.
Officers and executives of the national railway company rallied for two hours at the Gafsa train station.

Protester gathered in front of the national assembly to demand the restoration of diplomatic relations with Syria. The gathering is organized by the components of civil society announced the president of the association the suppoters of the resistance.
Professors went on a hunger strike in front of the Ministry of Education. They demand a changement in the recruitment procedure of the ministry.
Inhabitants from Ouidhet Leghzel blocked the road connecting Sidi Bouzid with Brij to protest against water-supply cuts. They took over various cars, including that of the local health delegation.
Protesters from Oued el Kamour started to block roads in Tataouine to protest against the first session of a commission that will get together in Tataouine.
Inhabitants from Mzara blocked the road connecting Sidi Bouzid with Bir Lahfey to protest against water-supply cuts.

column7: SNFSI: National Union of Internal Security Forces
column17: Hundreds of security guards gathered at the BPO headquarters in Tunis on Thursday, 06 July 2017 to protest against the attacks against them and to demand a protection law covering them during their missions.
Protesters from Oued el Kamour again blocked roads in Tataouine to protest against the first session of a commission that will get together in Tataouine.
According to the correspondent of Shems FM in Sfax, several sailors protested today in Sidi Mansour to demand the banning of fishing that destroys the natural environment.
Journalists, technicians and agents of the private radio station Cap FM have been following an open sit-in in front of the radio station in Hammamet since last Thursday.
The city of Menzel Bouzayene in the governorate of Sidi Bouzid is experiencing various kinds of protests at the headquarters of the municipality, delegation and social advancement unit.
About 300 workers in the electronic boards' factory in Mas'adiya area have been protesting for a week to demand a range of professional rights.
Inhabitants of Barghouthia closed the road to other delegations of Kebili and began a sit-in, demanding deveopment and employment in the region.

Employees of the mineral water plant Aziza are observing a sit-in this morning, Saturday 8 July 2017, delegation El Krib governorate of Siliana. The strikers carried slogans calling for the revision of working hours and the improvement of working conditions in particular.

The General Secretary of the cable factory union confirmed the closure of the factory and the laying off about 400 workers. He added that the workers carried out a protest in the headquarters in Kef state, after they were informed that the factory will be shut and 400 workers will be laid offs despite a commitment made by the director two months ago not to shut the factory.

Agents and employees of the SOS Children's Village in Siliana protested on Monday, 10 July 2017, in front of the governorate headquarters, demanding the non-closure of the village, which shelters several children.
Inhabitants of Dojdej neighbourhood in Djebel Jalloud protested against the water cuts that last already 2 weeks.

According to shemsfm, 100 people coming from 7 different reigons came to the local representation in Sidi Bouzid to protest, asking for new municipal divisions which they currently consider as not being in their interest.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Exchange of gunfire between national guards & 3 armed militants reported ~17h in the Kasserine Governorate near the #Algeria border. Tunisia: MOI confirms that an NG patrol was subjected to gunfire by 3 AQIM/KUBN militants in Boudrias 3km from DZ border.

The headquarters of the Local Labor Union (UGTT) in Skhira in the governorate of Sfax was yesterday Tuesday July 11, 2017 the target of an attack. A cross was drawn on the facade in addition to threats to fire the premises.

Components of civil society and human rights held on Tuesday, July 12, 2017, a protest under the slogan ""our children are not for sale"" in front of the headquarters of Jendouba governorate. Protesters came especially from Fernana city as from there many children are employed as housekeepers.

Workers on the wholesale fruit and vegetable market in Sousse organized a sit-in on Wednesday 12 July 2017 in front of the headquarters of the governorate to protest against the non-payment of outstanding debts from the intermediaries.
Several political parties and associations today held a demonstration in front of the headquarters of the Ministry of Culture to demand the cancellation of a show by Michel Boujenah.

The residents of Mdhilla have blocked the road to protest against repetitive cuts in the distribution of drinking water. It is not clear with what the road has been blocked but buses were damaged to prevent the transport of workers into a phosphate company.

On Thursday, 13 July 2017, pensioners organized a demonstration in Sidi Bouzid denouncing the delay in the payment of the increases by the government. Increases that should have been paid since last January.
People from the Nega region held a sit-in at the Kebili de-salination station to protest the high levels of salt in the water.
Workers at the Trunisian Insurance Company held a protest to demand that the Ministry of Finance change a corrupt contract.
Skirmishes took place between police and vendors, who had been evicted from Sidi Boumendil in Tunis. The vendors stoned the police, injuring 2 officers.
A youth group began a peaceful march from Menzel Bouzaien to Tunis.
Substitute teachers held a demonstration in Tunis to protest their working conditions.
A police officer was hit by a coffee seller during a protest against the police campaign to clear street vendors. The coffee seller has been arrested.
Property destruction: The houses of 2 security agents in Tozeur were burned down by unidentified attackers.
A youth group continued their peaceful march from Menzel Bouzaien to Tunis.
Manich Msameh held a protest outide the Tunisian parliament to protest the Law of Reconciliation.
Police clashed with demonstrators who had gathered to protest the comedian Michel Boujeneh's show in Carthage.
A youth group continued their peaceful march from Menzel Bouzaien to Tunis.
A youth group which had marched from Menzel Bouzaien to Tunis was blocked by the police, who assaulted some of the marchers and tried to prevent them from approaching the government buildings.
Arriving on July 21 in the capital from Menzel Bouzaine, the ""sit-inners of resistance"" observed a protest movement in front the Prime Ministry in Kasbah.
After they were blocked from entering the stadium and left off the delegation list, young sports people in Tebourba rioted and demanded to be represented.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Citizens of Rahma, in Menzel Bouzelfa, blockaded the main road to protest their lack of running water. When the National Guard arrived to clear the blockade, the protesters attacked them with stones, causing 5 injuries.
3 youths were injured in Oued Oum Zouggar, when military forces shot at them. The military claims that the youths failed to obey orders.
7 police officers were injured in clashes between police and street traders in Kasserine, during a police campaign to clear up illegal street trading.
Security forces had to intervene in a clash between the Ouled Mahmoud Clan and the Ouled Mbarek Clan in Gafsa. 9 people were injured.
Arrests: The National Security Directorate had a security sweep, in which 685 people were arrested.
Looting: 2 militants entered a house near Mghila. They looted a large amount of food and threatened the occupants.
Police forces stormed a group of Manich Msemah protesters who were attempting to pitch a tent outside the parliament, causing a riot.
Manich Msemah protesters gathered in front of parliament to continue their protest, which had been disrupted the previous evening.
A truck carrying soldiers in Mghila caused a mine to explode. There were no injuries or material damage.

Several members of the internal security forces in Medenine organized a protest rally on Monday, 31 July 2017, asking the ministry to grant promotions and distinctions to agents who participated in the ""Heroic Battle of Ben Guerdane"" during which the Islamic State was pushed out of the city.

Three sit-inners from the Skhira delegation held a sit-in on the main road to Skhira industrial zone, denouncing authorities' failure to re-employ them and to keep their promises regarding environment protection.
Forest workers and work mechanisms protested on the road between Beja and Ain-Drahem on 2 August 2017 in response to the suspension of activities in the forests.

column9: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019); Military Forces of Italy (2013-2018)
column17: Non-violent activity: Amidst the ongoing ""fishing war"" a Tunisian cutter fired shots at Italian fishing boats. An Italian Navy helicopter and a Tunisian military vessel reportedly intervened, persuading the vessel to back off
Inhabitants of Kebili organized a sit-in in front of the seat of the governorate to demand the closure of a clinic after 4 sick people died being treated there.
The spokesperson of the protests in Douz confirms that the protesters continue to close the gas and petrol taps in the region, after negotiations the day before failed.
The director of the 'STEG' (electricity)-branch in Bouhajla and a guard were violently assaulted by two individuals from rioters who allege that they were deprived of electricity.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Tunisian security forces have killed two militants belonging to the Okba ibn Naffa brigade during an operation in Jebel Birinou near the Algerian border. A third suspect was critically wounded. There are some conflicting information on whether the militants belong to Okba ibn Nafaa brigade or to Soldiers of the Caliphate but one name of victim given, leads to assume the former.

The employees of the oil company Winstar, located in the El Faouar region in the governorate of Kebili, organized a sit-in on the morning of Friday 11 August 2017 in front of the company's headquarters.

Protesters from the localities of Borj Salhi, Ghormane and El Kodia, in El Hawariya, proceeded this Friday to block the road between Al Hawariya and Tunis. And this to protest against the cutting of running water on their localities for about twenty days, and the indifference of the authorities in front of their complaints.
The workers of a hostels in Sousse held a protest and blocked the tourist road in front of the hostel, to protest the non-payment of wages.
Protesters in Kebili closed the gas-taps from the Perenco petrol company in El Golaa yesterday to show that their demands for employment and development have not been met yet.
Employees from a company in Msaken blocked the road to denounce the failure to comply with the agreements found to solve the problem of the company which has closed its doors for more than a month.

Coordinator of civil society organizations indicated that the Gabes-west delegation was forcefully shut down by protesting Chnenni residents on 14 August 2017. The coordinator allegedly who refused the creation of a municipality.
Inhabitants from El Baten in Kairouan protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Kairouan to show their dissatisfaction with tap-water and electricity cuts.

Merchants located at the central market of the city Erriadh in Sousse held three day tsrike. The shopkeepers left their stalls to protest against the anarchic display and to demand the opening of points of sale of fish and meat.
A group of strangers attacked the office of Slim Riahi, president of the UPL-party, on Tuesday, August 15, 2017.
Taxi drivers from Sfax, belonging to the UGTT, organized a demonstration in front of the city hall in Sfax asking for a proper system of driver authorisations.

Workers of the Sidi Tilil Mills Company cut off the main road Tlabat / Feriana to protest against the company's use of a quantity of imported wheat that does not conform to the applicable quality, causing it some losses. The protesters burnt tyres on the road.
